boardgame.name: 10 Commandments: A Party Game
boardgame.description:
"Ten Commandments" is a fun and simple card game. But there is a big difference between this game and all the others: The commandment cards! These commandments make the game different every time you play, and make the players do or don’t do various things to avoid getting penalty points.

How to play:
Each player at their turn must play a card first, and then take a card from the draw pile. The main rule is: You can never play a one-digit card on another one-digit card, and a two-digit card on another two-digit card.

Commandments:
Two commandments always govern the game: 1. Sneezing is forbidden! 2. Saying ‘I’ or ‘Me’ or ‘Myself’ is forbidden! Eight more commandments will be added to the game randomly during the play. Commandment Cards add different rules to each game, making it very competitive and fun. So, all you need to do is to obey the commandments, or delude others into disobeying them!

All players must obey the in-play commandments. Failing to do so must be penalized by one Penalty Token. At the end of the game, the player with the least penalty points is the winner.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Wild Magic
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The magic of your spell spirals out of control and the careful flow of arcane energy begins to flood outward...

This chart provides 100 widely varied outcomes for wild magic, as well as rules for making it happen. The standard chart is written for Dungeons and Dragons 5th Edition, but special changes and notes provided for Pathfinder and Pathfinder Second edition.

Provide your players and friends with a truly unique experience they'll never forget!

boardgame.name: The Misty Isles (S&SS)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Explore a chain of islands full of interrelated danger, intrigue, and adventure that can be woven into an entire campaign. Originally published in 1977 for the world's first roleplaying game, this classic setting sourcebook has been adapted specifically for use with Swords & Six-Siders™, the 1d6-based OSR rules.

The map for each island uses a hex overlay, with descriptions of possible encounters provided for each applicable hex. New rules (including travel and ship combat), monsters, and a bonus tenth island are also included.

boardgame.name: Diver Caschy
boardgame.description:
How good of an observer are you?

A game where finding the same patterns and objects will give you victory. With beautiful characters from the PUNA salteña.

Players must search among the cards in their hands and the cards available on the table, those that are combined correctly to be able to make groups of three. Whoever gets the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

boardgame.name: The War Road
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

As the kingdom of Blackmoor celebrates the dawn of a new year, a Thonian priest with vital information concerning the plans of Toska Rusa and the Afridhi Horde stumbles into South Pim with his enemies in pursuit. Will you escort him along the War Road, across the Great Dismal Swamp, to the city of Blackmoor?

A Blackmoor: Shattered Empires mytharc introductory adventure for first level player characters.

User summary:

The scenario is distributed as four separate PDF files:

20-page scenario
1-page AC (adventure certificate)
4-page CC (character certificate)
4-page print-and-play handouts

boardgame.name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Silenced men
Le Trône de Fer: le Jeu de Figurines – Hommes du Silence
boardgame.description: The crew of Silence, a ship of the Greyjoy fleet, is made up of mutes with extraordinary martial prowess.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Greyjoy Starter Set

boardgame.name: Prime Customers
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

As the winds of winter begin to die down, representatives from UnKany’s Arms and Wares are seeking a group of experienced and expendable individuals to locate a critical shipment thought lost in the Great Dismal Swamp during the height of winter.

A Blackmoor: Shattered Empires standalone introductory adventure for second level player characters.

User summary:

The scenario is distributed as four separate PDF files:

18-page scenario
1-page AC (adventure certificate)
3-page CC (character certificate)
5-page print-and-play handouts

boardgame.name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Stag knights
Le Trône de Fer: le Jeu de Figurines – Chevaliers du Cer
boardgame.description: The Knights of the Stag are among the most prestigious Barathéons fighters, equipped with heavy armor and powerful two-handed weapons.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Baratheon Starter Set

boardgame.name: El Lavarropas
boardgame.description:
Ordering socks has never been so much fun!! With each wash, the stockings get cluttered and are never left with their peers. In this game, each player must complete their drawer of socks.

Each player must memorize the socks they have in their drawers and then try to find, among the disordered socks, the ones that their pairs complete.

boardgame.name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Bloody mummer skirmishers
Le Trône de Fer: le Jeu de Figurines – Tirailleurs des Pitres Sanglants
boardgame.description: These mercenaries are as cruel as they are talented. Don't be fooled by their colorful outfits!
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Neutral Heroes I

boardgame.name: The Eastern Marshes
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

South of the Kingdom of Blackmoor lies the largest empire known to man. It is sometimes referred to as the Republic of Thonia or the Great Kingdom and was founded over 1000 years ago by King Robert of Geneva. The Empire today stretches from the Jungle Realm of Tangor in the South to the Northern Marches in the North. Its current ruler is Emperor Iyx I.

boardgame.name: The Thonian Rand - Edge of the Empire
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Out of all the provinces of the Thonian Empire, the province known as The Rand is probably the most militaristic. Since Blackmoor declared independence from the Empire after Uther’s Rebellion, The Rand now forms an important part of the Empire’s northern border. If you want to run a fantasy game set in a region where the heroes can liberate slaves, fight against oppressive armies, explore unique technology or visit shady pirate ports, this is Province is a good starting point for your campaign in the World of Blackmoor.

boardgame.name: Bleakwood - The Highlands
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

South of the Kingdom of Blackmoor lies the largest empire known to man. It is sometimes referred to as the Republic of Thonia or the Great Kingdom and was founded over 1000 years ago by King Robert of Geneva. The Empire today stretches from the Jungle Realm of Tangor in the South to the Northern Marches in the North. Its current ruler is Emperor Iyx I.

boardgame.name: House Baratheon Card update
A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Baratheon card update pack
Le Trône de Fer : le Jeu de Figurines – Paquet de Mise à jour Edition 2021 : Maison Barathéon
boardgame.description: Find all the cards from the 2021 update in this pack of cards intended for Maison Barathéon players.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Baratheon Starter Set

boardgame.name: Concordia: Digital Edition
boardgame.description:
Concordia: Digital Edition is a faithful adaptation of a strategic board game ranked in the Top 20 board games of all time.
Build the greatest trade empire of ancient Rome!
Concordia: Digital Edition is a faithful adaptation of a strategic board game ranked in the Top 20 board games of all time. Plan ahead and make crucial decisions every turn. Always be prepared to make a trade-off - your actions can very well benefit other players as well as yourself.

What is Concordia?
Concordia: Digital Edition is a turn-based strategy game where 2 to 6 players face each other in the fight for wealth and influence. You will build your trade empire on one of several maps of the ancient world. Using actions on the cards you will plan and execute your strategy to get an edge on your competition. Each of your decisions can benefit both you and your opponents. Send your colonists to new cities, across the land or sea, and build houses to expand your trade empire!

What makes Concordia great?
Concordia is a game with rules that are easy to learn, but mastering it can take a lifetime! With additional maps and expansions along the way (all the official ones, in fact), the replayability of Concordia: Digital Edition is near infinite. Play against the AI or challenge your friends in the hot seat mode or online cross-platform multiplayer. The authentic feel of the board game, along with the intuitive UI makes it the perfect addition to your gaming collection!

What can you expect?
• Build your trade empire
• Trade goods and expand to different cities
• Manage your colonists, storage space, and action cards
• Try out a variety of different maps
• Customize your game with expansions modules
• Become the greatest merchant of ancient Rome!
• Easy to learn, hard to master
• High strategic depth. Be ready to make trade-offs!
• Official Concordia rules consulted with the game's designer
• Play with AI, friends, or both - a great experience for both solo and group play
• All of the official expansions will be released
• Unique experience of a board game with the convenience of a digital platform
• Interactive tutorial that will teach you how to play

Build the greatest trade empire of ancient Rome!

boardgame.name: Fall of the Dwarves
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Empire of Thonia: The Thonian Rand - Edge of the Empire introduces the Duchy of Evedhur. The idea with Evedhur was to expand on the lore of Dwarves from the Blackmoor Campaign Setting.
...
The following is the outline for a campaign where the players will have a chance to determine the fate of the Duchy of Evedhur.

boardgame.name: House Targaryen card update pack
A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Targaryen card update pack
Le Trône de Fer : le Jeu de Figurines – Paquet de Mise à jour Edition 2021 : Maison Targaryen
boardgame.description: Find all the cards from the 2021 update in this pack of cards for House Targaryen players.

boardgame.name: Williamsfort Gazetteer
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Williamsfort is located on the northwestern slope of the Stormkiller Mountains near the entrance to Stormkiller Pass. The road from the pass follows the crest of a ridge through the foothills of the mountains around a forested piedmont area located southeast of the city.

boardgame.name: Sweetwater Gazetteer
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Sweetwater is located on the north bank of the Root River along the road between Bramwald, of the Empire of Thonia, and Newgate, of the Kingdom of Blackmoor. The village owes allegiance to the Baron of Newgate.

boardgame.name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Neutral Factions card update pack
Le Trône de Fer : le Jeu de Figurines – Paquet de Mise à jour Edition 2021 : Neutres
boardgame.description: Find all the cards from the 2021 update in this pack of cards for Neutral and Mercenary House players.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Neutral Heroes I

boardgame.name: Castle Newgate Gazetteer
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

One of the newest noble houses in the Kingdom of Blackmoor is the House of Zvenzen. The House of Zvenzen was founded in 1019 when the newly crowned King Uther Andahar, made Svenny the Baron of Newgate as a reward for Svenny’s tireless efforts in Uther’s support. The coat of arms for the House of Zvenzen is a white shield with a thick black cross on it with five white stars set in the black cross and a maroon sword in the upper right-hand corner.

The main stronghold of the House of Zvenzen is Castle Newgate. While previous and upcoming books in this series detail the rest of the lands of this Barony, this book will focus on the castle itself and its inhabitants.

boardgame.name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Free Folk card update pack
Le Trône de Fer : le Jeu de Figurines – Paquet de Mise à jour Edition 2021 : Peuple Libre
boardgame.description: Find all the cards from the 2021 update in this pack of maps for Free People players.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Free Folk Starter Set

boardgame.name: Noble House of Zvenzen
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Blackmoor, the Lord Of The Northern Marches, sent his knight. The Great Svenny, to collect the annual tribute owed to him by the Orcish King of Servile. In Servile, The Great Svenny learned that soldiers governed by the King of Greyhawk, along with certain elfish allies, were at that moment warring against the local King. Being a trustworthy and obedient knight, and inasmuch as Servile was a protectorate of King Alf. The later then led an expedition to meet this army. After emerging victorious. The Great Svenny seized a traitorous elfish count, Ordonez, and subjected him to the ultimate insult - he plucked the count's hair. But when this vengeful count returned home to The Great Forest, he convinced King Alf that The Great Svenny had become dangerously powerful and must be banished from the kingdom.

boardgame.name: Royal Tiles
boardgame.description: App clone of the board game Azul.

boardgame.name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Night's Watch card update pack
Le Trône de Fer : le Jeu de Figurines – Paquet de Mise à jour Edition 2021 : Garde de Nuit
boardgame.description: Find all the cards of the 2021 update in this pack of maps intended for players of the Night's Watch.

Le Trône de Fer : le Jeu de Figurines – Paquet de Mise à jour Edition 2021 : Maison Lannister

boardgame.boardgameexpansion: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Stark vs Lannister Starter Set

boardgame.name: Chaotic Toongeon
boardgame.description:
The non-greatest heroes of the kingdom will face the evil villain in the fifth level of the chaotic dungeon. They will explore and find better, powerful (or useless) weapons, objects and equipment inside the five levels of the dungeon. However, the path to the darkness is full of danger, so they must collaborate with other adventurers knowing that, in the end, only one of them will rise with glory (and countless fortune).

Each turn, a player draw as many cards of the Heroic Action Dack as his hero can pick. Then, he can use as many of this cards in order to do any action (attack, explore, defend, move, etc.)

The game ends when the villain in the fifth level is killed.

The player with the most heroic points at the end of the game wins. A player can get heroic points by killing monsters, completing secondary missions or overcoming traps.

boardgame.name: House Stark Card update
A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Stark card update pack
Le Trône de Fer : le Jeu de Figurines – Paquet de Mise à jour Edition 2021 : Maison Stark
boardgame.description: Find all the cards from the 2021 update in this pack of cards for Stark players.

boardgame.name: D&D Adventurers League Dungeoncraft Adventures: Wild Beyond the Witchlight
Dungeoncraft Wild Beyond the Witchlight Designers Pack
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You can create your own Dungeons & Dragons adventures set in a fey domain of your own design using The Wild Beyond the Witchlight and Domains of Delight provided you follow the guidelines provided in this document.

This item is distributed as a ZIP archive containing multiple small PDF files (totaling 72 pages), four DOCX template files (totaling 18 pages), and one JPG logo:


D&D Adventurers League Dungeoncraft Adventures: Wild Beyond the Witchlight
Adventure Design Guide
D&D IP Guide
DMGCh05 Building Encounters
DnD House Style Guide
DnD Standards
Forgotten Realms Style Guide
Stat Block Creation
1- D&D 5E Template (DOTX)
2- Using the D&D 5E Template (DOCX)
Magic Item Format (DOCX)
WBW-DC Adventure Format (DOCX)
ADVL Primary Bage Community (JPG)
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: D&D Adventurers League Dungeoncraft Adventures: Wild Beyond the Witchlight
Lost Things, a Prelude Adventure
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Like a half-forgotten dream, the Witchlight Carnival drifts into our world once every eight years, drawing folk of all ages to delight in its fey wonders. Entry without a ticket is strictly forbidden, and the consequences for trespass echo through time. A two-hour prelude adventure for The Wild Beyond the Witchlight campaign. During this two-hour adventure, your players create kid characters and explore the carnival unaware of the malevolence that lurks within.

CONTENT WARNING: Magical charm, fairy-tale abduction
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: D&D Adventurers League Pack: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight
Welcome to the Witchlight Carnival
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

D&D Adventurers League Pack: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

It’s finally here! Every eight years, the Witchlight Carnival comes to town and delights guests from far and wide with games, food, and other magical delights! Step right up and enter, but make sure you’ve got your ticket!

This product contains everything you’ll need to immerse your players in the fey domain of Prismeer. It includes:


WBW The Wild Beyond the Witchlight Adaptation. This provides guidance for how to run The Wild Beyond the Witchlight in an Adventurers League setting. It even includes suggestions on how to break the adventure down into 2-hour sessions; perfect for scheduling game days or planning your convention.
WBW-EP The Witchlight Carnival. Want to experience the Witchlight Carnival as an immersive, multi-table 3-hour event? Then look no further; this provides guidance on how to do it! This is an epic adaptation of Chapter 1 of The Wild Beyond the Witchlight.
WBW-PR: Lost Things, a Prelude Adventure And last but certainly not least, this prelude adventure is set years before the events that transpire in The Wild Beyond the Witchlight. During this 2-hour adventure, your players create kid characters and explore the carnival unaware of the malevolence that lurks within.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: Respuestas Abiertas: Imágenes
boardgame.description:
Respuestas Abiertas: Imágenes makes you travel to a world of infinite possibilities where limits are given by imagination and the ability to invent original stories or phrases.

One player is the storyteller for the turn and looks at the images on the 5 cards in their hand. From one of these, they make up a sentence and say it out loud (without showing the card to the other players).

Each other player selects the card in their hands which best matches the sentence and gives the selected card to the storyteller, without showing it to the others.

The storyteller shuffles their card with all the received cards. All pictures are shown face up and every player has to bet upon which picture was the storyteller's.

If nobody or everybody finds the correct card, the storyteller scores 0, and each of the other players scores 2. Otherwise the storyteller and whoever found the correct answer score 3. Players score 1 point for every vote for their own card.

The game ends when the deck is empty. The player with the most points wins.

boardgame.name: Reap
boardgame.description:
Become death and play as a new Reaper each turn, trying to seize more souls than your fellow Reapers.

Players will each draw a new Reaper Card, Place 1-3 skull tokens on either the Reap, sweep and keep located on their reaper card, behind a small Screen. Reveal their cards and take turns Reaping (moving their Reaper Meeple around the board), Sweeping (removing the less desirable souls off the board) or Keeping (attempting to out bid other players for souls of the same type that their meeple is standing on)

The Player who successfully claims 9 souls by succesfully outbidding the others is the winner!

boardgame.name: Los Buscapistas
boardgame.description:
Based on the famous series of juvenile books, with Los Buscapistas, you will play with Pepa Pistas, Maxi Casos, Bebito and Pulgas, to try to solve as many mysteries as the city of Basketville.

Los Buscapistas is a card game with a simply "worker management" you can win mystery points. The player who wins more points will be the winner of the game. The game contain 60 cards, 8 big cards, and personalize dice.

In your turn, move you character to location cards to get new clues, help or try to discover mysteries to win points. The first player who win 30 points will be the winner of the game.

Los Buscapistas is a family game for 2-4 player, 6+ or more age and 20 minutes of game.

boardgame.name: Viking Death Squad
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Viking Death Squad is a tabletop RPG set in the desolate world of the 100th century. Players take the role of immortal warriors or resourceful survivors against foes demonic and cybernetic.

For blood and justice.

boardgame.name: The Solo Adventurer's Toolbox Part 2: The Toolbox Expanded
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Within these pages you will find tables and tools to provide a more detail-rich game of solo D&D. This book simply builds on The Solo Adventurer's Toolbox, providing more generators, whole new random non-combat encounter tables, new systems for playing solo, and many other resources.

boardgame.name: Hard Wired Island Player Reference
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This [book] contains all the rules you need to play Hard Wired Island. Check out Hard Wired Island for setting details, GM advice, example scenarios and more.
...
In the distant future of 2020, humanity has spread to space.

boardgame.name: Quingo
boardgame.description:
Quingo is a Roll and Write game that includes the box, 22 dice, 80 score sheets, and a rules document.

The goal of the game is to score the highest amount of points by the end of the game. Quingo takes place over a series of rounds, where players pull dice from a collective dice pool to record their scores. Each game, the bonus's vary for each category, changing your strategy per game. Also, each round in each game each player may be limited with the number of scoring combinations that are available, depending on their personal player die.

You must use strategy, luck, and your whits to outlast your opponents. Survive other players forcing you to take the dice that you don't want, or taking all the dice from the table, leaving you no options.

boardgame.name: No Room for a Wallflower
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to No Room For A Wallflower, Lancer’s first narrative campaign.

In No Room For A Wallflower, you and your players will explore the recently rediscovered world of Hercynia. Once rich with biodiverse life, the Second Committee transformed Hercynia into the proving ground for the first mechanized chassis Now, it is a healing world, buried and forgotten in the administrative chaos of the Third Committee’s successful revolution. Only rediscovered as the new bureaucracy addresses the loose ends left behind by its imperial predecessor, you will soon find that Hercynia holds secrets that will shock the galaxy.

A scarred world is about to tell the story of its wounds...

boardgame.name: Mimic Mansion
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You are a mimic who is breaking into a mansion. Your goal is to eat to increase your mass until you can eat the sacred gem.

boardgame.name: Champion of Fallen Gods
boardgame.description: From the description:

boardgame.name: Bridge-A-Word
boardgame.description: A word card game where words are made from letter cards held in a special stand for them.

boardgame.name: Declare
boardgame.description: A word game, played from cards that have one letter each on them.

boardgame.name: Do You Remember When?
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You are a group of retired ghost hunters who, after years of estrangement, are reuniting for dinner and drinks on the anniversary of your retirement. You begin to reminisce, and as the night goes on you, the players, will discover together the history behind how you got started, some of your greatest escapades, and perhaps even how you finally split up.

A normal Dread scenario involves a single storyteller and four to six players. While it is possible to play this scenario with a single storyteller, it has been specifically designed to allow every player who is willing, to take a turn as the storyteller.

boardgame.name: Abandoned Giants Forge Halls
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Do you want to run a spooky adventure for your D&D group?

This map is perfect for any dark, creepy adventure. It's filled with abandoned tools and other items that are just where they would be if the giants were still there. You can easily run an entire one-shot session in this environment!

The chasm breathes cold air throughout the halls, making it feel like something isn't right here. There's no reason why the giants would have left all their things behind - but everything is exactly where it would be if they were still around. It's uncanny and unwelcoming, so you'll definitely get some good scares out of this map!

boardgame.name: Sky Isles World Tree
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Looking for a fantastical map of floating sky isles to use in your next D&D game? No? Well, now’s the time to consider it! :P

Sky Isles World Tree is the perfect battlemap for any areal adventure. This beautiful and detailed map features floating islands, a giant tree, two magical pillars, and so much more (check out the sample image!). It’s also available as an instant download so you can start playing right away.

The detail on this map and the free adventure prompt that comes with it will make it easy to plan your next session. Get ready to explore these sky-high isles today!

boardgame.name: Underdark Ritual Site Entrance
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Welcome to the Underdark!

It's a place of mystery and danger. It’s also home to some of the most powerful magic in the world. This map is an entrance to one of many ritual sites that are scattered throughout the Underdark. You can use this map for any game system you like - it's perfect for any underground caverns in Dungeons & Dragons, Pathfinder, Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay, and more!

Your players will love exploring the cavernous maze, of which this map forms a small part. A stream of green water flows through the cavern and off a steep cliff into darkness below. Glowing purple and red fungus cling to the walls and walkways, making your players feel like they're deep underground in an alien environment full of danger around every corner!

boardgame.name: Mysterious Ice Cave
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Your party has been tasked with finding the entrance to a mysterious ritual site within this network of ice caverns.

There are two pillars before you, but only one is lit. What could it mean? You can hear a stream of frigid water flowing through over frost covered stone and off a steep cliff into darkness below. All around you the sounds of ice and stone creaking echo off the walls, alongside the sound of water dripping from the ceiling. It’s time for your next adventure!

Explore this dungeon map now by clicking Add to Cart above! This map will be perfect for any D&D campaign or tabletop RPG game that needs an icy location to explore!

boardgame.name: Crimetime: Fall 001 – Bis dass der Tod Euch scheidet...
boardgame.description: A murder without a witness. The perpetrator: unknown. Take on the role of the detectives. Can you manage to solve this authentic case? Or will the murderer strike again and scare Guntwil again?

boardgame.name: Crimetime: Fall 002 – Vater vergib mir, ich habe gesündigt
boardgame.description: A brutal murder of a clergyman. Is the main suspect really guilty? You slip into the role of the investigator and, in this case, travel to San Giotto in Italy. Can you clear up this authentic sacred crime thriller?

boardgame.name: Unravel Words
boardgame.description:
A word card game.

First make words from the letter cards dealt to you. Make any number of any length. Longer words score more but are easier to guess. You get points for each letter used, and bonus points for each letter over 3 in a word, for your longest word being longer than other’s longest words, and for using all your letters in words.

Next guess words. The more precise the guess, the more points you make. You get 1 point for a successful general guess like “Do you have any Ls?”, and 5 points for successful specific guesses like “Is this card an L?” There are bonus points for guessing a player’s last hidden letter and knocking them out of play, and for your letters still hidden when a player is knocked out. When there is only one player left, the one with the highest score wins.

Feel the excitement as you try to work out everyone else's words before your words are all guessed out.

[Adapted from the back of the game box.]

boardgame.name: Pez
boardgame.description:
Pez is a card game made up of 48 cards of 16 species of fish from our La Plata basin.

The complete deck represents the food chain of the river. The general idea of the game, with variations depending on the modality chosen, is to equal or exceed the numerical value of the card played by the immediately preceding player or by the opposing team (there are hand-to-hand modalities, individual up to 9 players and by teams in duos and trios). The player who plays the highest card takes the trick.

The winner or winning team is the one who manages to obtain more than half of the total possible points: there are 50 in total, as a reminder that the river is a living being and that the fish populations are not infinite.

boardgame.name: Piedras del Universo
boardgame.description:
Piedras del Universo is a game based on the mythology of our region, the Argentine Litoral. The theme is aimed at redefining natural spaces and putting players in contact with legends, customs and characters from native cultures.
The objective of the game is to obtain the 4 Stones that are originally located in the center of the board and are represented by pyramids. This is achieved by entering the box where the stones are or by taking them away from the other players, using the same method.

On each turn, a player can move their avatar, use nature powers, or change nature cards to summon one of the 4 animals on the board, so that more than one avatar can be used per player. If a player is caught, he loses the elements that he has been adding in his game (cards, powers, stones, animals) and returns to the origin, from where he re-enters the board.

The game ends when a player manages to collect the 4 Stones of the Universe

Throughout the game we can find sacred spaces of protection, with characters known to all such as the flap, the pachamama, the salamanca, native animals and the use of powers of nature to achieve objectives.

Piedras del Universo invites meeting, collaboration, concentration and strategy development, in addition to training adaptation to the unexpected and problem solving. Its instruction manual is at the same time, the construction of a story full of characters and situations that help us learn more about our own mythology.

boardgame.name: Archmage Stronghold
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Archmage Stronghold is a Fifth Edition plug-in adventure for four characters with an average party level (APL) of 11, 14, 17, or 20. This document offers details for each level and makes adjustments accordingly.

Plug-in Adventure
As a plug-in adventure, the adventure content serves as plug-in material for game masters who wish to add a small dungeon to a preexisting campaign or need a side quest. If you need a hook for this adventure or already have a similar hook, the Archmage Stronghold Hooks table offers details for introducing this adventure to your players.

Product Description
The following items are included in this product:

Dungeons & Lairs 3: Archmage Stronghold premium color adventure PDF (18 pages!)
12 new monster stat blocks
Full-size map of the Archmage Stronghold by DMDave

boardgame.name: Animated Objects
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Animated Objects is a Fifth Edition plug-in adventure for four characters with an average party level (APL) of 1, 3, 5, or 8. This document offers details for each level and makes adjustments accordingly. The adventure pits the characters against a plethora of new animated objects. Be sure to review their stat blocks in the Appendix before running this adventure.

Plug-in Adventure
As a plug-in adventure, the adventure content serves as plug-in material for game masters who wish to add a small dungeon to a preexisting campaign or need a side quest. If you need a hook for this adventure or already have a similar hook, the Animated Objects Hooks table offers details for introducing this adventure to your players.

Product Description
The following items are included in this product:

Dungeons & Lairs 4: Animated Objects premium color adventure PDF (12 pages!)
Premium color PDF supplement with 22 new monsters (13 pages!)
Full-size maps by Tom Cartos

boardgame.name: Amazon
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Super-Powered by M&M RPG release brings you Amazon Enhanced Archetype. This ready-to-go character build provides a foundation for you to develop a female hero of your own who excels at physical combat and is a general badass. Gamemasters can also use the archetype as the basis for quickly building NPC heroes or villains off-the-cuff.

Each Enhanced Archetype presents the basic build, plus ideas for some typical roles the character may fill, along with variations you may want to explore.

boardgame.name: Beyond Damage Dice 2
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Weapon is Much More than Just the Damage It Deals…
Down to 5 hp and fighting for your life against trolls, dragons, werebeasts, or worse? You’ll need to use your weapons to their fullest potential: to confuse, disorient, and disadvantage your enemies before moving in for the kill.
Beyond Damage Dice 2 offers unique maneuvers for specific weapons found in the core Fifth Edition rules—giving them a distinct impact on the battlefield—and introducces entirely new weapons for dwarves, elves, kobolds, and orcs! Unless the description specifies otherwise, all of the maneuvers in Beyond Damage Dice 2 can be used by any character that’s wielding the appropriate weapon and is proficient with it.
Fully 5th Edition-compatible, Beyond Damage Dice 2 includes:
13 pages of maneuvers for monk and samurai weapons including manuevers for daitō, naginata, nunchaku, as well as maneuvers for dwarven weapons, elvish weapons, kobold weapons and orcish weapons!
11 new weapons, including the fiery dwarven dragonhead, the clever kobold catchpole and improvised explosive! In addition, you'll find the massive orcish gorgash and chained handax, not to mention the elvish joining blades, windrunner bolas and more!

Peruse this volume of martial secrets and learn how to set up a spinning shield, a crushing bonebreaker, a disarming parry, and more!

boardgame.name: Crumbs: Foul Waterfowl
boardgame.description: A game of scuffles, revenge, and feeding on the fear of your enemies NOW GETS WETTER with the Foul Waterfowl expansion. Foul Waterfowl introduces TWO ADDITIONAL playable armies, secret objectives, brand new Daily Buzz cards (including RAMPANT cards) and four additional maps to play on with new terrain-based mechanics. The most fan-requested park animals will now join the fray: the Geese and the Swans.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Crumbs

boardgame.name: Path of the Fey Champion
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Unleash your rage!

The Path of the Fey Champion is a 5e barbarian subclass inspired by Celtic myth. In this primal path, your rage brings on a warp-spasm - a grotesque and glorious transformation gifted you by the powers of Faerie.

boardgame.name: Scion: Car Competition
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Automobiles are entrenched in The World’s culture, and they’ve changed travel forever. The Gods are not immune to the changing culture, and many Scions have incorporated it into their legends, pushing themselves to interact creatively with vehicles. The Scions of Hephaestus had a particular attraction to vehicles, often modifying them beyond the human capability for speed or maneuverability.

These and other interested Scions often come together for competitions and test racing or craftmanship. Car culture is so popular with certain Scions that they developed a game based on them. The game is sometimes called “The Autocracy,” which a few Scions think is a hilarious pun, while others consider the joke to be in poor taste. Most just call it “the competition.”

The competition consists of multiple ways for Scions to play with vehicles when they are together and an opportunity to tell legendary tales of their feats. Powerlift a car in the middle of a battle and use it like a baseball bat? Throw a truck a mile to take out an enemy running away? Did you trick out a motorcycle to make it a Relic? How are those driving skills?

All of these are ways in which Scions try to outdo each other. Some prefer the heat of battle for their moment of glory, some choose to express themselves through nuanced storytelling in their cars’ design, others weave tales of impressive feats or clever uses of vehicles, and still others hone their skills of repairing or modifying the internal machines and external bodywork. Creativity, originality, and innovation are the central ideas of the competition.

boardgame.name: Korea Solitaire
boardgame.description:
Korea Solitaire covers the first year of the war.

Three types of naval units: gunfire, transport, amphibs. Amphibious invasion have to be planned two turns in advance.

Air units represent two groups each: tactical air, B-29s, F-86s, airlift. Communist airpower is represented by an AA track (interceptors+flak) which "fires" at UN Command air. You can knock down the AA level by air superiority missions. Other air missions include close support and interdiction. Interdiction is against the Communist logistics level. The lower the level, the less likely the Communists will go on the offensive. Thus, you have to allocate your airpower for what you think is thebest strategy.

Two random events table: one for the North Korean invasion, the second kicks in when the Chinese enter. One random event is Soviet air intervention, which raises the Communist AA level considerably. Reinforcements: these come in on randomly determined turns, mainly to show fog of war and vary each game. You can also bring in US units from the strategic reserve, at a cost in victory points (these include elements of the 2nd Armored and 82nd Airborne divisions).

Special rules:
US mechanized task forces (you can form them from divisions).
Chinese logistics surges (gotta do more interdiction to counter this!).
Eighth Army commander: either Walker or Ridgway, each with their own advantages.


Published in Strategy & Tactics #349

boardgame.name: Kitty Cat Clash! Card Battle Game
boardgame.description:
Kitty Cat CLASH!™ Card Battle Game is a free-for-all card battle game for two to six players. Be the last cat standing and you win! Play as one of seven different cats each with their own unique deck and claim victory by knocking out every other player in this free-for-all clash. Each cat’s traits, skills, and quirks are represented by their deck of cards.

Game includes 7 thirty card decks, 7 stamina trackers, 7 character tokens, 6 reference cards, 23 swipe tokens, and rules.

boardgame.name: How to Train Your Dragon: Terror of the Sea
boardgame.description:
Bring your family together for this easy to learn board game set in the magical world of burly Vikings and wild Dragons. Be the First Viking to climb the volcano to WIN!

Each Viking Teen travels along the game path by rolling the die, and advances the number of spaces. The space you land on will direct you to either twist the base of your pawn either 1 or 2 "clicks" or to spin the pawn. Each pawn has 2 sides: the Viking Teen indicates the front and their Dragon is the back. Whichever direction the Teen is facing when the spinning is done is the direction the player will move next turn (forward, backward, or along the main path). First player to land on the Winner space by an exact roll "flies" their dragon up to the Volcano's cloud to final victory and WINS!

Contents:
1 Game board with magical spaces & 3D Volcano Walls
4 Viking Teen Pawns and Spinning Bases (Teen on front, Dragon on back)
1 Die
Full Instructions
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Movies: How to Train Your Dragon

boardgame.name: Nicaea
boardgame.description:
It's the year 325 and it's a pretty chill time to be a Christian.

Not only has it been a hot minute since they were forced to renounce their faith on pain of death, but the emperor Constantine has really leaned into it, hoping it will unite the often fractured Roman Empire. So, the big guy isn’t super-thrilled when bishops immediately get into nit-picky, esoteric arguments that John Quintus Romanus doesn’t give two flips about. He demands that the bishops gather together in the city of Nicaea to come to an accord. He doesn’t really care what these nerds decide, so long as they decide something.

This gathering is given irreverent treatment by Amabel Holland in this game for four, five, or six players. Like Constantine, it treats the theological positions argued at the first ecumenical council as fungible. Whether a position ends up accepted orthodoxy or damnable heresy has nothing to do with theology and everything to do with politics - with personal ambition, petty rivalries, and social dynamics. This is a sort of shared incentives game, in which each player commits to one of two sides in various theological disputes; guess which one the majority will go with and you’ll score points. Score the most points, and you’ll win the game.

Unless the player with the fewest points has accumulated the most political influence. That player is powerful enough to splinter the church, provoking a schism and stealing the win. To prevent this, you’ll need to make sure that someone that powerful isn’t left out in the cold during the final settlement.

At once a slick tableau-building game and a study in emergent alliances, Nicaea gives a rude but affectionate raspberry to what was perhaps the most pivotal event in the history of the early church.

listing.notes:
Opened but unplayed.
Buyer agrees to pay shipping, flat $10.00 to continental U.S.

boardgame.name: Flights, England to Australia by air
boardgame.description:
Flights, England to Australia by air is a roll and move race game where players travel a path across the globe from Croydon in England to Darwin in Australia. Along the numbered path players encounter favourable or detrimental problems such as "take an extra turn" or "Return to Croydon for a new plane". The winner is the first to arrive in Darwin, Australia.

Published in Victoria, Australia, the playing map and aircraft path patriotically highlight the influence of British colonial rule during the late 20's and early 30's. Further to this it lists the pioneering aviators who made the journey during the early 20th century up to Amy Johnson in 1930.

boardgame.name: Expansion counters and rules for Michael Resch's 1914OaO and 1914SmS games
boardgame.description: These are counters that the designer created as part of an update project for 1914 Offensive a Outrance and 1914 Serbien muss Sterbien games. They include errata fixes as well as new counters to work with the designers additional Optional Rules for the games. A double-sided sheet of explanatory notes and rules is included in this package.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: 1914: Offensive à outrance
1914: Serbien Muss Sterbien

boardgame.name: Damn the Torpedoes!: Action Off Charleston
boardgame.description:
On January 29th, 1863 the British blockade runner Princess Royal was pursued by USS Unadilla and run aground while trying to enter the harbor at Charleston, SC.
Her cargo included arms and ammunition as well as an unrecorded number of large rifled naval guns and two powerful steam engines slated to be installed in Southern ironclads then under construction.
These imports were of such great potential value to the South that they have been called "the war's most important single cargo of contraband."

In thick, predawn haze on January 31, 1863, CSS Chicora and CSS Palmetto State raided the Federal blockading force of unarmored ships lying just outside the entrance to Charleston Harbor.
Their goal was to drive the blockading vessels away from the Princess Royal and recover her cargo.

–Description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Damn the Torpedoes!

boardgame.name: TLNB Universal (Common) Card Decks
boardgame.description:
A simple, optional "Card Enhanced" mechanic that impacts on reinforcements and movement in games in The Library of Napoleonic Battles series.

There are separate decks for the Coalition and French player.

Specific decks were originally included in each game of the series but from Napoleon's Wheel onwards a common deck will be used together with instructions in each game on how to customise the deck.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: The Library of Napoleonic Battles (OSG)
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Napoleon Invades Spain: Peninsular War, Part I
Napoleon's Wheel

listing.notes: TLNB UNIVERSAL CARD DECK FRENCH ONLY
TLNB UNIVERSAL CARD DECK COALITION ONLY

boardgame.name: Carrara palotái (második kiadás)
Paláce Carrary
The Palaces of Carrara (Second Edition)
카라라의 궁전
boardgame.description:
In The Palaces of Carrara, players want to buy the marble from this famous region of Italy as cheaply as possible – but any reduction in price will benefit your opponents as well. Maybe you'll find it profitable to instead invest in the buildings created from this exclusive marble? Maybe it'll be more worthwhile to grab the expensive raw material when bigger buildings in town turn out to be not as lucrative as you'd hoped?

This second edition includes a revised set of rules, as well as a completely new advanced version that will include many new strategies and ways of scoring. This new advanced mode of play introduces statues, which will allow you to score your buildings in a multitude of new ways. So come and revisit this classic game by famous designers Wolfgang Kramer and Michael Kiesling.

boardgame.name: Escape Adventures Wendepuzzle: Gestrandet
boardgame.description:
After their boat was destroyed in a heavy storm, the players strand on a mysterious island. They have to solve various puzzles in order to leave again. But the island holds a secret, they didn't expect ...

Escape Adventures is played in two phases: First, the players have to piece together a two-sided, round puzzle. Than they begin to solve puzzles. Some of them require to turn the whole puzzle around, as some important information is only found on one of the sides.

A booklet contains the story of the game that develops as players solve more puzzles. To see if they solved the current puzzle correctly, players use special puzzle tiles to see if their solution forms a continuous line of a specific color.

The game aims to brimg the experience of an Escape Room to the home of the players. It can be played multiple times as no material gets destroyed while playing.

boardgame.name: Kinoko
boardgame.description:
In Kinoko, each player secretly draws a color card corresponding to a family of mushrooms — musicians, scientists, etc. — and gets a hand of three mushroom cards.

On your turn, roll the three dice, then choose one of them. The result of that die, whether a number or an icon, determines your action: exchange two cards, swap two sets of cards, pick at any card secretly, etc. To win the round, you must gather the three members of your family in one location during your turn. This reunion can happen in any player's hand or on the table.

Seems easy? The trick is you can see only the cards in other players' hands, and your decisions are limited to what you roll on the dice. What's more, each round one family of mushrooms turns poisonous, and having a card of that color in your hand when the round stops earns you a negative point...

The round's winner scores positive points, and the first player to 4 points wins.

boardgame.name: Crescent Moon
boardgame.description:
As the sun rises over the deserts, rivers, and oases of the Caliphate, a delicate balance has been upset. As one of many rival powers in the region, you now have the opportunity to alter the course of history and seize power for yourself. The ambitious Sultan sits in a golden palace, presiding over great works of architecture. The secretive Murshid works to covertly undermine the central authorities through an expansive network of agents.

The wandering tribes of the Nomad aim to sow discord in order to secure employment for their experienced mercenary citizenry. The ravaging forces of the Warlord sweep across the land, chasing after promises of plunder. And, in the face of chaos and uncertainty, the Caliph aims to preserve order through military might. Will you successfully navigate this web of rivalries and rise to prominence, or will you squabble with your lesser adversaries and fade into obscurity?

Crescent Moon is played over three years (or four years in the long game). Each year, players will take four actions which might be to deploy new armies, enlist mercenaries, build fortifications and settlements, conquer new land, expand their influence, and much more. Each character has a unique pool of abilities and available actions, which will shape their game, whether its the Sultan, who cannot raise their own army and must depend on mercenaries, or the Murshid, who can use their political influence to interfere in other characters' battles. Players can purchase potent power cards, representing ploys, wise advisors, and specialist units from a market shared between all players. At the end of each year, players score points according to their own unique character objectives, and at the end of the game, the player with most points wins.

Crescent Moon is an area control game for four or five players. Take on the role of one of five radically asymmetric characters, each with their own objectives to fulfil, unique actions to utilise, and game-changing special powers to employ. Build symbiotic relationships with your allies, undermine your rivals, and choose your friends and enemies wisely in this cut-throat game of power and politics.
