boardgame.name: Havoc! The Combat Card Game
boardgame.description:
Havoc! The Combat Card Game! is a fast-paced cards-and-dice game of deadly hand-to-hand combat. Set in the era of swords and shields, spears and axes, Players take on the role of Knights, Barbarians, or other fighters locked in a deadly struggle.

Players can choose combat scenarios from a range of historical eras, or from fantasy settings. After choosing fighters, weapons, and armor, Players build and shuffle decks of Combat Action Cards. Players then draw a Hand of cards and play each Combat Action one at a time. Players win when they kill or incapacitate their opponent.

A fighter is out of the fight when they are reduced to 0 Body, and the game ends when all fighters on one side are out of the fight.

A player wins when they reduce all their opponents' to 0 Body.

boardgame.name: Startups & Beyond
boardgame.description:
In this game, you dive into the competitive/cut-throat/ruthless world of Startups and Beyond.

All too often, the startup world is celebrated for its victories and the challenges are glorified. While there is a lot to learn from successful startups, many lessons are discovered from those that fail too. Startups and Beyond will take you through the highs and the lows of this fantastic journey as a founder of a product company.

In Startups & Beyond, players are Founders of Product Companies and have to constantly plan and execute their strategies to build an economic engine that is resilient to any external forces which make the economic cycles unpredictable.

Players can choose from different categories of products that have different manufacturing costs and lead times.
Players can choose to redesigned their products to give a better margin or add new products to diversify their risk of competition eating into their margins.

Players play the game simultaneously where they try to snag the best talent from the market to help with the product, marketing and sales strategies. Players also have to balance their spending, can raise funds from an investor or just take a bank loan based on their finances. As a founder, players can discover hacks and overcome roadblocks during the game. Every action has a cost attached to it and affects the end game scoring.

The game ends after playing 8 quarters (2 years).

The game includes worker placement, card drafting, economics and engine building mechanisms.

boardgame.name: Aegis of Empires Otherworlds Guide
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Take Aegis of Empires to Other Worlds!

The Aegis of Empires Otherworlds Guide is here, merging the adventures of the Aegis of Empires Adventure Path with some of the most famous and popular campaign settings around. Lead designer Greg A. Vaughan provides guidance for setting this awesome adventure saga in Greyhawk, Golarion, Forgotten Realms, and Eberron, including where to place each adventure and how to connect them with official adventures from each of those campaign worlds. Plus, Greg walks you through his personal Aegis of Empires campaign setup, including the adventures he's used to put all the pieces together and the heroes of his home campaign!

boardgame.name: Fiends of the Cosmos
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Powers of Corruption!

Long have tales spoken of inhuman evils, entities of corruption and ruin with countless names and faces. Their abilities are incredible, their intentions nightmarish…

And now, their secrets revealed!

Spheres Bestiary: Fiends of Cosmos introduces players to 18 mighty fiendish foes ranging from the lowly Imp to the corrupting Nightmare Prophet to the alien Elemental Cyst to the mighty Abyss-born Tyrant. Also contained within this book are numerous new feats for outsiders and seven expansive templates for creating new fiends of your own design. Seize upon this archive of strange powers and witness what the Fiends of the Cosmos truly have to offer.

boardgame.name: The 90s Sucked Ass Or Whatever
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The 90s Sucked Ass Or Whatever is the nineteenth in a series of "Zine Supplements" for #iHunt: The RPG. Or as we'd like to call them, "Zupplements." It's also the fourth in our Season Three series of zupplements, each detailing a different decade of the 20th century in the world of #iHunt.

This one details the 1990s, and it's 42 pages of irreverent goodness!

Inside, you'll find:

Pop Up History: A series of current events flashpoints, each with story ideas for how to tie that event or phenomenon into your #iHunt stories.
Killing Monsters in the Bubble Economy: Six new monsters, a whole new monster clade inspired by Clive Barker's Nightbreed, and ideas for how 90s monsters are similar and different than 2021 monsters.
Guest author, Danesha Artis, writes "#iHunt at the Continental," a short story about how the hunt might have looked in the 90s.
iHunt pogs! You can print and play with your very own collectible #iHunt pogs! 24 of them to be precise.

boardgame.name: Eldritch Essences: Promethean
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Transcendence at any price...

Drawing the dark tapestries of the Mythos and cosmic horror, Eldritch Essences: Promethean introduces a new player class-the Promethean. Driven by reckless Obsession the Promethean seeks ever deepening mysteries of power unlocking each at the cost of their dwindling humanity.

This volume contains:

The Promethean base class a veilweaving champion of the secrets of forbidden lore and dark obsession.
Four Obsessions to guide your character’s descent into power and lost humanity: the Adaptationist, the Doppelgänger, the Fleshsculpter, and the Thoughthunter.
New Veils including the powerful new fleshwarps to expand existing veilweaving classes like vizier, nexus, and more.
New City of 7 Seraphs lore regarding the class and its place within Hyraeatan.
New feats and magic items to support the new class and bring their power to other characters.


Can you master the power before it masters you?

boardgame.name: Achtung! Cthulhu Player's Guide
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A New Secret War begins!

Welcome to the Secret War in this fast-paced pulp-influenced rollercoaster of an RPG which nimbly mixes the sanity-challenging terror of Lovecraftian cosmic horror, with the chaos and heroism of World War II.

Enter a world of audacious Allied agents, malicious Nazi villains and the unfathomable gods and monsters of the Mythos themselves, each striving for supremacy in mankind’s darkest yet finest hour!

Answer the call with the dauntless men and women of the Allied occult forces: Britain’s Section M, the United States’ Majestic, or the brave Resistance, all willing to make the ultimate sacrifice to hold back the legions of the Nazi occult.

Battle the Black Sun, Nazi warrior-sorcerers supreme, who use foul magic and summoned creatures from nameless dimensions to dominate the battlefields of men. Struggle against Nachtwölfe, the Night Wolves, who utilise technology, biological enhancements, and wunderwaffen (wonder weapons) to win the war for Germany. Can you prevail against such overwhelming odds, or will you succumb, like so many others, to the terror of the Nazi occult or the malign influence of the Mythos?

This is your story to tell!

Inside this 178+ page full colour US letter sized hardback you’ll find:

• Complete rules for playing Achtung! Cthulhu, using a custom version of the cinematic 2d20 system to create thrilling scenes, awesome adventures, and epic campaigns.

• A complete step-by-step guide to building your Secret War operative which mixes archetype, background and characteristic to create a truly unique agent.

• Use singular talents, powerful weapons, and mighty vehicles to take the fight to the Nazis.

• Explore an innovate new magical system which allows you to wield powerful sorcery. Play as a Celtic druid or Norse Runeweaver, or harness the uncanny power of the mind as a psychic operative.

• Created by a team of Lovecraft adepts and second world war aficionados who have crafted an RPG which is easy to pick up and play, but boasts huge depth and flavour!

boardgame.name: Achtung! Cthulhu Gamemaster's Guide
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Direct the course of the new Secret War!

Welcome to the Secret War in this fast-paced pulp-influenced rollercoaster of an RPG which nimbly mixes the sanity-challenging terror of Lovecraftian cosmic horror, with the chaos and heroism of World War II.

As a gamemaster you will bring to life this pulp-influenced world of brave Allied heroes and dauntless two-fisted adventure, guiding the heroic actions of players while also directing the twisted might of the Nazi occult: the Cult of the Black Sun, who wield foul magic and summon captive horrors and Nachtwölfe, their rivals who place their trust in Atlantean technology, weird science, and strange wonder weapons.

You will shape a world where dread secrets and powerful artefacts lie forgotten in ancient ruins, where dusty tomes are replete with eldritch knowledge, and you’ll arm players with experimental technology, deadly weapons and powerful magic, to do battle with this uncanny threat.

You’ll bring to life exotic races like the Deep Ones, undersea worshippers of the dreaming god Cthulhu, or the strange Mi-Go, fungoid-insectoid beings who have come to Earth for an unknown purpose. You’ll also control the sanity-sapping monsters, entities and gods of the Mythos themselves, who seek to take advantage of the chaos of the second world war to extend their dominion over the minds of men.

Will your players prevail against all odds, or will they, like so many others before, fall to the malign influence of the Mythos? That is your story to shape and tell…

Inside this Gamesmaster's Guide 260+ page full colour US Letter sized hardback you’ll find:

Dedicated advice on the art of gamemastering including managing the game economy and specific tips for creating memorable characters, adventures and campaigns to thrill and delight your players.
Major new lore and detailed background information on the six major factions contesting the Secret War: Section M, Majestic, Black Sun, Nachtwölfe, the Deep Ones and Mi-Go including their backgrounds, history, hierarchy, secret bases and missions and goals.
A vast repository of hidden lore and forbidden magical knowledge including new Mythos books and tomes, powerful ritualistic magic, plus the damnable spellbooks of Nyarlathotep, Yog-Sothoth and dread Cthulhu himself!
Arm your players with a wealth of new weapons and espionage devices from secret government labs and classified research departments with the Secret Weapons of the Secret War chapter.
Complete profiles and statistics for the powerful heroes and villains of the Secret War, the men and women who do battle for the fate of mankind, plus a huge bestiary brimming with all the terrifying gods, monsters and entities of the Mythos themselves.

boardgame.name: Advanced Olde Swords Reign: Rules and Magic
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Advanced Olde Swords Reign, a tabletop roleplaying game with modern mechanics taken from the 5E SRD (System Reference Document) and based on the original 1974 edition and later Advanced Editions of the World's Oldest Roleplaying Game and some of those editions supplements. It is not a retro-clone but more of an homage to the "old-school" style of play that is more readily accessible to modern gamers.

Rules and Magic is filled with over 300 spells, 12 classes, 7 races, feats, backgrounds, rules for combat, and more.

boardgame.name: Advanced Olde Swords Reign: Monsters and Treasures
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Advanced Olde Swords Reign, a tabletop roleplaying game with modern mechanics taken from the 5E SRD (System Reference Document) and based on the original 1974 edition and later Advanced Editions of the World's Oldest Roleplaying Game and some of those editions supplements. It is not a retro-clone but more of an homage to the "old-school" style of play that is more readily accessible to modern gamers.

Monsters and Treasures is filled with over 200 monsters and NPCs, 100's of magical items, rules for Olde Swords Reign Referees, and more.

boardgame.name: Inseln toppen!
boardgame.description:
Inseln toppen! is a reimplementation of Länder toppen!, but this time, you are playing with islands rather than countries.
The game mainly consists of cards which show an island and some data about that island: size, population, highest mountain etc. Each player has a cardboard strip with 12 slots. In each turn, you get a number of island cards and a few blanks, and you place them face-down in the different slots at the strip, either above or below. The blank cards are used so you don't give away which slots you are using. When all players are done, everyone reveals the first card and compares the first value (size), and the player with the highest number wins. In the second slot, the smallest size wins, etc.
After each trick, the winning player sorts cards they won by ocean. At the end of the game, whoever has most cards for a given ocean scores for that ocean, ohter players discard their cards for that ocean. The player who has most cards afterwards, wins the game.

boardgame.name: Gi-Go
boardgame.description:
The players each take turns placing one of the 49 game pieces on a 7x7 playing field. The player who places a tile on the last square of a vertical, horizontal or diagonal row receives the victory points for this row according to its length (vertical and horizontal 7 each, diagonal 2 to 7). As soon as the last tile has been placed, the player with the most points wins.

The game has appeared in a series of games with educational intentions.

boardgame.name: The Ants: Underground Kingdom
boardgame.description:
In The Ants: Underground Kingdom, you are the ultimate Ant Ruler to lead your Queen and build your Anthill.

To survive and reproduce, wars between animals take place frequently in nature. In The Ants: Underground Kingdom, you are the ultimate Ant Ruler to build the Anthill, lead the Queen, grow the colony, and defend against enemies. For the glory and prosperity of your ant empire, you must show your own strategies resourcefulness.

Source: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.star.union...;hl=nl&gl=US

boardgame.name: Non Speed Race
Нескоростной забег
boardgame.description:
A cooperative game, a noon speed race between the turtles and the snails. The turtles look at each other or to the next turtle on the board to move on to the next step. If the players cannot find the turtle who looks at the previous turtle or the next one, the snail moves to the next step.The players win if they filled the board with turtles, before the snails moved to the last step.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Massive Darkness 2: Zombicide Fantasy Crossover Pack
boardgame.description:
Zombicide Fantasy Crossover Pack is a Kickstarter Exclusive Optional Buy that brings you over 110 cards to allow you to use a lot of the retail content from Zombicide: Black Plague and Green Horde in Massive Darkness 2: Hellscape. It will also allow you to use many of the Massive Darkness 2: Hellscape Heroes and Enemies in Zombicide: Black Plague and Zombicide: Green Horde!

25 Hero Cards to bring the main Zombicide Fantasy Survivors as Heroes for Massive Darkness 2: Hellscape.

54 Mob cards, 30 Roaming Monster cards and 1 Boss dashboard to bring many Zombies as Mobs, Roaming Monsters, and 1 Boss as Massive Darkness 2: Hellscape Enemies

Survivor ID Cards to bring the Massive Darkness 2: Hellscape Heroes as Zombicide Fantasy Survivors (compatible with both Zombicide Black Plague and Green Horde):
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Massive Darkness 2: Hellscape
Zombicide: Black Plague
Zombicide: Green Horde

listing.notes:
Worldwide tracked shipping 15€
IBAN or PayPal (+6%)
opened to check contents, cards still sealed

NEW! Kickstarter Exclusive!
+Shipping
PayPal and Venmo payment preferred.

boardgame.name: Labyrinth of the Goblin Tsar
boardgame.description:
Descend into the black depths of the Goblin Tsar’s labyrinth in your next roleplaying campaign with this Epic Encounters warband box! Compatible with fifth edition or any fantasy roleplaying game.

Down in the labyrinth, the chittering shadows seem alive. Hungry. Perhaps it’s not the Tsar you should fear, but the one he serves. The one who consumes disobedient goblins and lost travellers alike. The one they call the many-legged prince...

Inside this warband box, you’ll find everything you need to unravel the evil of the Tsar, including 20 highly detailed minis and an adventure book woven with information to fuel your imagination.

Can you brave the depths and end the terror? Use Labyrinth of the Goblin Tsar as a standalone encounter or as part of a new or existing RPG campaign!

boardgame.name: Web of the Spider Tyrant
boardgame.description:
Ensnare your roleplaying group in a sticky situation with Web of the Spider Tyrant, containing all the ingredients you need to run a skin-crawling Giant Spider encounter! (Including a SCARILY detailed Giant Spider miniature on a 100mm base.)

Compatible with 5e or any fantasy roleplaying game, Web of the Spider Tyrant is an Epic Encounters boss box that takes you deep into the spider’s web.

There in the dark depths lurks the Spider Tyrant — an ancient fear, old as time and twice as deadly. Few who encounter one survive, and those who do are forever changed.

Can you escape the eight-legged clutches of the ultimate fear?

boardgame.name: Piensa Palabra
boardgame.description:
Be the fastest to find a word that meets all 3 conditions.

For lovers of word games, comes this super agile proposal to train mental skills and vocabulary. A game where participants play simultaneously, trying to be the first to say a word that complies the given conditions.

For an easier game or to play with children, you can play with two or one of the categories.

SETUP
Shuffle the 3 condition decks separatedly and reveal the top card from each one.

GAMEPLAY
Each round, players try simultaneously to say a word that complies with the 3 conditions. The first player to find that word, gains 1 point and take one of the 3 cards of their choice, and replace it with the top one of the correspondent deck. Then the next round begins.

The same word can't be used again during the next 3 rounds.
The same category can't be replaced twice in a row.

END OF GAME
The first player to reach 10 points, wins.

boardgame.name: Kites
boardgame.description:
The sun is shining, the wind is blowing, and you know just what to do — gather your friends to fly some kites!

In Kites, everyone works together to keep all their kites — represented by colorful sand timers — in the air. Take turns playing cards, flipping the sand timers, and coordinating with other players to ensure none of the timers run out. If it does, a kite has crashed! Add complication cards for additional challenges.

Play all of the kite cards in the deck, and everybody wins!

boardgame.name: マカリョーシカ Macaryoshka
boardgame.description: Each player chooses a color of macaron. Players take turns either drawing mini macarons from a bag or choosing one from their personal supply to place on the board. If once color dominates a 4 piece area the macarons grow to the next size. If an area is tied for color, the player placing the last macaron chooses which color will grow. The player that triggers the growth will also determines which color(s) return to the bag. The game ends when one player has placed their two largest macarons or no more macarons can be placed.
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: natriumlamp games (ナトリウムランプゲームス)

boardgame.name: Trincea 1917
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Trincea non è un gioco di guerra.
Non si gioca per vincere un conflitto.
Non si gioca per lanciare tanti dadi e fare tanti danni.

Trincea è un gioco sui traumi della Guerra.
Si gioca dialogando con le altre persone al tavolo.
Si gioca senza cibo e bevande al tavolo.
Si gioca per guardare nell’abisso della Guerra.

Trincea 1917 è un gioco di narrazione condivisa per 3-5 persone, frutto di un lungo lavoro di ricerca e game-design, durato più di due anni, volto a rendere il framework nato con Kaiser 1451 (edito da Space Orange 42) un gioco che permettesse di raccontare una storia fatta di rinunce, dolore, logoramento e occasionale conforto.

Le storie che Trincea 1917 vuole aiutarvi a raccontare sono le storie di soldati al fronte durante la Grande Guerra che ha sconvolto il mondo all’inizio del XX Secolo.

Per aiutarvi a immergervi in quel breve periodo che cambiò per sempre la nostra Storia, il gioco è preceduto da un’introduzione di Alessandro Caresana (docente di Storia e Scienze Strategiche a Torino, Lione e Heidelberg) e seguito da un saggio di Andrea Limardo (docente di Storia e Filosofia).

Il testo è stato poi riletto, rivisto e ampliato grazie alle consulenze di numerosi specialisti, che hanno reso Trincea 1917 il gioco che siamo fieri di poter pubblicare insieme a Helios.

boardgame.name: Relick TCG: Retro begining
boardgame.description: expansion pack of the relick card game, in which you will find 20 new cards to expand the game
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Relick TCG

boardgame.name: Stone's Throw from Atlantis
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

When archaeologists unearth an ancient mystery with connections to the legend of Atlantis, they know that they’re making history.

But when past and present begin to collide, they soon discover they’re totally out of their depth...

User summary:

The scenario is distributed as a 26-page PDF scenario and four 1-page PDF print-and-play handouts.

boardgame.name: Crushed!
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

When A Miskatonic archaeologist uncovers an ancient idol defaced with Viking runes, he knows it could be the crowning achievement of his career.

When he discovers its true purpose, he won’t be the only person who’s crushed...

User summary:

The scenario is distributed as a 24-page PDF scenario and three 1-page PDF print-and-play handouts.

boardgame.name: King of the West
boardgame.description:
There’s somethin’ in the town of Backwater that don’t belong. It fills the air with energy, like it feels before a storm. Except this storm ain’t one of wind and rain, but bullets and blood.

King of the West is a weird west themed area control card game. Three different sets of characters will be available at launch. One set can be played as a 2-3 player 18-card area control game, but multiple sets will allow for up to 9 players with the modified rules variant.

For the area control variant setup, nine building cards are randomly played on a 3x3 grid to make up the town. Six buildings are generic locations and the other three are the unique target locations. Since they are played randomly, the location of these target buildings will be different in every game.

Players can take three actions on their turn: Claim a Building, Move, and Shootout! Shootouts are how you remove opponents from the buildings you want. You do this by trying to get into your opponent's head and out think them using a nuanced rock-paper-scissors combat system.

The game ends when either a player starts their turn controlling all three target locations or they are the only player controlling any buildings in the town.

With multiple sets and a larger player count, your still fighting over buildings, but instead of gaining a new location every turn, you are limited to what you start with. Players can't be eliminated though and when you run out of your buildings, you can steal someone else's. Other than that, combat works in the same way and the winner is the last person (or team!) left with claimed buildings.

—description from the designer
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: King of the West: Ghost Towns
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: King of the West: The Banished
King of the West: The Mavericks
King of the West: The Vigilant

boardgame.name: Children of Chaac
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Chichen Itza: a magnet to fortune hunters and scholars for centuries.

But when the ravages of the invader erase the memories of the past, the future can sometimes be measured in hours...

User summary:

The scenario is distributed as a 25-page PDF scenario and three 1-page PDF print-and-play handouts.

boardgame.name: 5 Room Dungeons Zine #3: Sublime Temple of the Slime God
Sublime Temple of the Slime God
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to The Sublime Temple of the Slime God.

What if oozes became intelligent and found the perfect home?

That's the conflict premise for this 5 Room Dungeon where the PCs must rescue children from an evil Oozemaster Druid and his dauntless pets.

This adventure features:

A complete 5 Room Dungeon ready to GM with minimal prep
New creatures including Ooze Master Druid, Awakened Gelantinous Cube, Psychic Purple Ooze
New magic item: Staff of the Ooze Master
New NPCs

boardgame.name: Crescent Moon ☾
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A Feelings-Delving Role-Playing Game

Go on a strange journey into the patchwork world of the daydream in Crescent Moon ☾, an all-ages role-playing game of brave children and bold adventures.

Rules for crafting your own whimsical tale full of breathtaking landscapes and unlikely friends await inside. Delve in to uncover stories of daring deeds and fantastical creatures—of calm afternoon naps and of promises whispered under starlight.

Will you find a way to travel out of the daydream?

What dangers will your shadows seed in your path?

How will you grow and change from your journey?

Take my hand and close your eyes. Let’s find out together.

The game is distributed as four PDF files:


33-page "Spreads" game document
64-page "Singles" game document
25-page Handout Set
30-page printer-friendly Handout Set (print-and-play)

boardgame.name: Ejército Popular
boardgame.description:
The players have the role of a republican agent during the Spanish civil war. Their objective is to buy arms in the black market or in the USSR to form new Battalions for the Popular Army. The behaviour of the battalions in combat and the achievement of our agent give us Victory Points. The game is divided in Battles and each battle has several turns.
There are 'Help' cards that are useful to manage your objectives or interfere with the other players activity.
Each player receives several Action Points, Negotiation Points, Money and Two help cards at the start of each Battle.
The battle can be 4 or 5 turns long so during that turns the players have to move their agent through the board spending their Points and money in the different boxes of the board in order to get arms, conscripts and uniforms for assembling a battalion or to send weapons to the High Command (demanded in the Battle card). Doing this gives Victory Points. At the end of the last Battle Card the player with more Victory Points win the game.
---
Los jugadores tienen el rol de un agente republicano durante la Guerra Civil Española. Su objetivo es conseguir armas en el Mercado Negro o en la URSS con los recursos limitados que se tiene y con estas armas formar batallones que demanda la carta de batalla que está en juego. El comportamiento de estos batallones en combate y los logros de los agentes proporcionan Puntos de Victoria. El juego se divide en 'Batallas' y cada batalla tiene varios turnos. Hay cartas de 'Ayuda' que facilitan tus acciones y tambien molestan a los otros jugadores.
Cada jugador recibe varios Puntos de Acción, Puntos de Negociación, dinero y dos cartas de ayuda al comienzo de cada batalla.
La batalla puede durar 4 o 5 turnos, por lo que durante esos turnos los jugadores deben mover a su agente por el tablero gastando sus Puntos y dinero en las diferentes casillas del tablero para obtener armas, reclutas y uniformes para armar un batallón o para enviar armas al Alto Mando (exigido en la carta de Batalla). Hacer esto da Puntos de Victoria. Al final de la última carta de batalla, el jugador con más puntos de victoria gana el juego.

boardgame.name: The Relic
boardgame.description:
From the description:

The Relic is a solo role-playing game in which the player takes on the perspective of a sacred object once belonging to a Saint.

What you’ll need:

- An hour or two set aside to play
- A copy of these rules
- A copy of the Relic playbook
- Paper and pencil
- A timer or other way to track time

boardgame.name: Back to the Mud
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

JUDGMENT DAY HAS ARRIVED!

In the ruins of Making, the Lord of Blades hammers out an army of steel to conquer the Five Nations of Khorvaire. With the Oracle of Bones at his side, he knows all plots against him before they can be enacted. He cannot be defeated---unless, of course, his enemies have their own Oracle. Optimized for APL 19, this is the third in a quartet of adventures, the Flames of War storyline.

Welcome to the Oracle of War campaign, a new 20-part standalone story for the D&D Adventurers League! You can play this adventure as part of your own Eberron: Rising from the Last War campaign, or as part of the Oracle of War organized play campaign. While this campaign runs under the umbrella of the Adventurers League, it utilizes different rules.

boardgame.name: Unholy Conspiracy
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The small town of ChapelRock has been plagued for too long by an elusive group of bandits. But things are about to change. The head of the Chapelrock garrison thinks he's located the bandits' informer. And he wants YOU to investigate the situation!

From a top-secret undercover mission, DUNGEON SOLO - UNHOLY CONSPIRACY will take you into caves full of traps and uncover a much bigger secret that will change the face of the world.

boardgame.name: Mountaintop
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 571st of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a mountaintop.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 2016x2160 pixels in size at 72dpi.

boardgame.name: Temple of the Flood
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 567th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features an old temple built to measure the river's annual flooding.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 2016x2160 pixels in size at 72dpi.

boardgame.name: Leap of Faith
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 568th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a dangerous gap in a rocky path crossing a sea of molten rock.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 2016x2160 pixels in size at 72dpi.

boardgame.name: Natural Pools
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 569th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a number of natural pools in a desert.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 2016x2160 pixels in size at 72dpi.

boardgame.name: The Bay
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 570th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a bay area.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 2016x2160 pixels in size at 72dpi.

boardgame.name: Asusta Cucos
boardgame.description:
In this game when the ant goes into action, the Cucos get scared. With Asusta Cucos you are going to put speed, concentration and coordination into play. The player who scares the most Cucos will be the winner.

All cards are dealt to players. Each player in turns puts their top card in the table, not covering any other card. If the And (Cuco scarer) is shown. Everyone has to cover, with their hands, cards of the most present color on the table, and they win that card if it is correct (and penalised returning a card if not).

The game ends when the last player card is shown, and each player counts the points on the Cucos bellies of the cards won. The player with the higher score wins.

boardgame.name: Biff! Bam! Kapow!
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

BIFF! BAM! KAPOW! is the "campy 1960s superhero television show" RPG!. The players can take on the roles of Hoot Owl and Screechy from the included sample series or create their own heroes and send them into the world of colorful theme villains, elaborate death traps and fisticuffs so zany that sound effect words appear in mid-air.

The game utilizes a modified version of the Intention System, which was designed to minimize prep time so that you and your friends can jump right into the action without a lot of fuss. And once you get started, you won’t have to devote four to six hours to playing. BIFF! BAM! KAPOW! is at its best when sessions last 60 to 90 minutes, as this is about the right amount of time needed to accommodate the same amount of story that would fit into a 30-minute episode of a TV show. The game was designed to pe played by one Showrunner and up to two players, though there are guidelines for adding more players.

Each and every rule in the game was included to facilitate collaboratively telling a fun story with your friends while faithfully emulating the feel of the superhero shows that graced television sets all over the world. This degree of accuracy in portraying the genre means that realism is sometimes—and by “sometimes”, we mean “almost always”—thrown right out the window. The TV shows that inspired the game affected an air of surrealism and campiness that often flew in the face of anything resembling logic. That’s half the charm, to be honest.

BIFF! BAM! KAPOW! is your ticket to a world that slightly resembles our own… but with a Dutch tilt. So gather around the table with your friends and join us in celebrating the zany and offbeat adventures of televised superheroes during the 1960s. We’ll be right there with you… same Owl time… same Owl channel.

boardgame.name: SoroPlay GamTools Zine Special: Mummy Ref
boardgame.description:
From ancient crypts to forgotten buried tombs to ornate sarcophagus filled with other mummies, valuable amulets, secret treasures, and tributes for the afterlife. Mummies come to life, resurrect, awaken, reanimate, and rise from the dead.

This even has a tool to help generate random adventure story scene synopsis or new dialogue based on interpreted results.

boardgame.name: Fantasy Folk: Elves
boardgame.description:
They're in the Trees . . . and the Seas, and Space

Elves were one of the first fantasy races, probably because so many cultures had something like them in their folklore. Thanks in no small part to J.R.R. Tolkien, they're also in the running for the most popular fantasy race. There's hardly a fantasy game out there without elves!

GURPS Fantasy Folk: Elves is the consummate guide to all things elven. It offers racial templates for a wide range of elves, special abilities that suit the elder race, and stats for their gear and animal friends. But it isn't just a bunch of rules and numbers – there's also a great deal of detail on history, culture, and mindset, and practical advice on using elves in any genre.

Skinny, pointy-eared humans? Oh, how wrong you are, youngster!

- Publisher's description

boardgame.name: SoroPlay GamTools Zine Special: Demon Ref
boardgame.description:
From ancient demons to seductive succubus to tempting fiends to plague bringing evil entities, demons possess, tempt, corrupt, and lead astray those whom which their influence capture. Demon hunters track, trace, find, and slay these evil spirits. In romance, manga, and anime, sometimes demons are lovers or partners. Your pleasure or passion is chained to their domains.

This even has a tool to help generate random adventure story scene synopsis or new dialogue based on interpreted results.

boardgame.name: ConSEXuate
boardgame.description:
ConSEXuate is a game of affective Sex Education, a trivia of questions divided into the following categories: Love and Eroticism, Prevention, Debate, Body, Gender, plus an instruction manual with their respective answers.

The cards are shuffled and the deck is placed in the center, a randomly designated participant will start the game by taking a card from the deck and reading the question or trigger aloud. At your convenience you can choose a partner to help you with an answer. Once the player answers correctly (the answer does not have to be textual), he keeps the card and we go to the next player, so on, the course of the game will continue. In case of not answering correctly, you must leave the card under the deck, the answers are found in this manual, so it should be kept throughout the game.

The cards are divided into colors according to their category. When drawing a YELLOW card, the group must answer together, creating a single answer among all. The player who touched this card must draw a new one for the individual response.

The game ends when the agreed session time is over. Whoever has the most number of cards is the one who knew the most to answer about sexuality. We all win by learning!!!

boardgame.name: Wyrd Science (Expert Rules - Vol.1/Issue 2 - Sep 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Wyrd Science returns with an even bigger and better second issue. 112 pages of interviews, news, features and reviews covering everything from the history of D&D B/X through to the best tabletop games of today.

In this issue you'll find...

Quickstart - get up to speed with what's happening with interviews with & features on: What Would the Smart Party Do?, Coyote & Crow, Jon Peterson on his new book The Elusive Shift, the latest gaming design trends, game inspired art and much more

Main features:

A celebration of D&D B/X's 40th Anniversary including interviews with game designers Stephen Marsh & David 'Zeb' Cook, Peter Bebergal on the books that inspired B/X & a look at the OSR scene and the best games of today inspired by it.
An interview with April Kit Walsh about her new RPG Thirsty Sword Lesbians
An interview with Cubicle 7's Emmet Byrne about Age of Sigmar Soulbound
An interview with games designer Jay Dragon about their game of pastoral exploration and healing, Wanderhome
An interview with Gavriel Quiroga about his new RPG Warpland
A introduction to the Latin American RPG scene by games designer Diogo Nogueira
A look at the new generation of model agnostic indie wargames from the likes of Space Weirdos to Reign in Hell
An interview with Pontus Bjorlin about his new RPG ALTNYC88
Interviews with pro-model painters Dana Howl, Brent Amberger, Amy Snuggs and Scott Walker and a look at how social media is changing that cene
An interview with best selling Black Library author Guy Haley
A look at the representation of women in the tabletop world today including interviews with the likes of Wingspan's Elizabeth Hargrave, 1minuteboardgames' Raina Medina, Dark Imp Game's Ellie Dix and Patricia Willenborg of Kismet Rose's D&D
Reviews: Age of Sigmar (3rd Edition), RPGs including Dune, Fallout, Achtung! Cthulhu, Inspirisles, Soulbound, Word Wide Wrestling, Whitehack, Caer Mundas, Old School Essentials, Animal Adventures and many more, and board games such as Oath and Uk'Otoa.

All this plus lots more...
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: Cast Pod: What Would The Smart Party Do
Hex Libris: Jon Peterson - The Elusive Shift

boardgame.name: Brute Race PCs for Old School RPGs
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

I have always found it fun to play a brute. Whether a gentle Neanderthal, rash and impatient Minotaur, or any other big dumb character there is a great deal of fun to be had smashing all your problems. When playing a brute there is no need to pay attention to minutiae details, write notes about things the GM has told you, or worry about the subtleties of an intellectual conversation with an NPC since all these things are blissfully beyond the capacity of the character. Presented here are four different player character races Keibu, Maricoxi, Minotaur, and Neanderthal.

boardgame.name: ConSEXuate Diverso
boardgame.description:
ConSEXuate Diverso is a game of affective Sex Education with focus on Diversity, a trivia of questions divided into the following categories: Love and Eroticism, Prevention, Debate, Body, Gender, plus an instruction manual with their respective answers.

The cards are shuffled and the deck is placed in the center, a randomly designated participant will start the game by taking a card from the deck and reading the question or trigger aloud. At your convenience you can choose a partner to help you with an answer. Once the player answers correctly (the answer does not have to be textual), he keeps the card and we go to the next player, so on, the course of the game will continue. In case of not answering correctly, you must leave the card under the deck, the answers are found in this manual, so it should be kept throughout the game.

The cards are divided into colors according to their category. When drawing a YELLOW card, the group must answer together, creating a single answer among all. The player who touched this card must draw a new one for the individual response.

The game ends when the agreed session time is over. Whoever has the most number of cards is the one who knew the most to answer about sexuality. We all win by learning!!!

boardgame.name: Forest Glade RPG Encounter Map
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Forest Glade - RPG Encounter Map

60" x 40" image showing a large clearing in a forest.

Ruins and caravan stop theme versions also included

Optional 1" grid versions also included

Files included:

For Large Format Printing

300 DPI JPEG (all versions)

For Virtual tabletop

72 DPI JPEG (all versions)

boardgame.name: King of the Jungle RPG Encounter Map
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

King of the Jungle - RPG Encounter Map Pack

This is a 36x36 battle map of a set of overgrown jungle ruins in grid or no grid options in both print ready (300DPI) and VTT optimised files.

Files included:

For Large Format Printing

300 DPI JPEG with 1" square grid

300 DPI JPEG with no grid

For Virtual tabletop

VTT optimised JPEG with 1" square grid

VTT optimised JPEG with no grid

boardgame.name: Deep Span Bridge RPG Encounter Map
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Deep Span Bridge - RPG Encounter Map

60" x 40" image showing a great stone bridge spanning a river of lava, with optional square grid.

Broken bridge, river, shadow chasm and warped theme versions also included

Files included:

For Virtual tabletop

Alos included is a token to show the gate as closed.

boardgame.description:

Whistling Gulch Crypts - RPG Encounter Map

50" x 50" image showing a series of dungeon chambers with a river cutting through them, includes optional square grid.

Dry riverbed, lavca and warped theme versions also included

For Large Format Printing

For Virtual tabletop

boardgame.description:

Fenbank Manor - RPG Encounter Map

50" x 30" image showing an old ruined manor house and its out buildings in a riverside swamp, with optional square grid.

Night and poisoned theme versions also included

Files included:

For Large Format Printing

For Virtual tabletop

140 DPI JPEG (all versions)

boardgame.name: Ogre Crown Falls RPG Encounter Map
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Ogre Crown Falls - RPG Encounter Map

50" x 70" image showing a carved face in a cliff side with waterfalls eiter side, includes optional square grid.

Wasteland, forest, desert and winter theme versions also included

Files included:
