For Virtual tabletop

72 DPI JPEG (all versions)

boardgame.name: Arde ConSEXuate
boardgame.description:
Arde ConSEXuate is a fun, adult game that challenges you to talk about sex.

The deck is placed face down in the center of the table. The most HOT player begins and from there to the left of him he will continue the round. The starting player picks up a card from the deck, reads it aloud and performs the action / command. If he complies with this card, it remains in his power, in the event that he does not comply, he will have to have a drink or make a garment that the group designates.

Who first manages to get to keep 5 cards wins.

boardgame.name: Valley of Peril
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

From perilous forests, ruins and roads through to dark caves and dungeons, your adventure starts here!
With rats, bandits, goblins, taverns, cellars and many more tokens you have all you need to run the encounters you want.

This System Agnostic Starter Set contains:

300+ Tokens of monsters, adversaries and terrain
24 Modular 11” x 17” maps for tabletop roleplaying
Maps combine to make larger encounter areas

boardgame.name: The Lark & The Nightingale: A Highwayman's Tale
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

"The Lark & the Nightingale: A Highwayman's Tale", a short adventure module set in merry old England. A story featuring action, romance, the supernatural, and an old wrong that must be set right.

The module includes a list of inspirations for the GM to watch, listen, or read to get the feel for the story elements and also "Crib Notes" to help the GM run game without having to flip so many pages. The module also includes rules suggestions for running with a beginning group and also options for running with more advanced groups.

The Contents of this product include:

20-page adventure text
4-page Crib Notes
2-pages featuring 7 sample PCs so you can dive right into the adventure.
2-pages with the inspirational poem "The Highwayman" by Alfred Noyes
Guidelines on how to run a Tavern Brawl.

boardgame.name: Empatizate
boardgame.description:
It all starts with EMPATHY, which is the ability to perceive, share and understand what another may feel. With Empatizate we are going to talk about bulliyng, gender equality, racism, beliefs, safety on social networks, substance abuse. We will learn to say YES, NO and I DON'T KNOW. This game allows us to anticipate and solve interpersonal conflicts and achieve a greater emotional connection with people. When you say "Empathize", it is to put yourself in the place, defending the cause, for 1 minute in both cases in a mandatory way.

The “YES”, “NO” and “DON'T KNOW” are placed in the center of the table and 5 cards are dealt to each player.

Each player reads his cards and strategically chooses one to pass to the player on his right saying "empathize". This action must be done by everyone at the same time. The youngest begins to answer and from there to the right of him one by one during 1 round. If you meet the slogan, score points, if not. The answered letters are left on one side.

The game ends when all the cards in hand are answered. Cards are scored at the top. Whoever scores the most points wins.

boardgame.name: Totoro64
boardgame.description: Totoro64 is a arcade game for Commodore 64 by Gabriele Gorla. The theme is around the Totoro movie from Studio Ghibli.

boardgame.name: Hopp
boardgame.description:
With the help of wooden see-saws, you shoot colourful wooden dice into the ‘target box’. (The felt lining muffles any noise!)

Depending on the position inside the grid, the dice hitting the targets score points. Special rules also apply for skilled players; no matter how much chance intervenes, the more you play, the easier it becomes to score hits and the bar can be raised higher. The dice and see-saws can be packed into the solid and lockable wooden box to take away.

The games ends after all dice are thrown.
The player with the most points win. Points depend on the position of the dice in the Target box

boardgame.name: Curse of the Eternal Undead
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In Curse of the Eternal Undead, a group of level-7 characters encounters rumors and truths about a strange development in the jungle. Scores of mindless undead come from a decrepit pyramid in the jungle's depths. The undead ravage the land, kill townsfolk, and have forced the locals to flee from their homeland in search of safety. A local guide and former adventurer has explored the territory and looks for a group of saviors to join and fight.

The adventurers learn that some of the undead are not aggressive nor obedient to the one who created them. They are cursed with a semblance of life; caught in a loop for eternity. A fate that no one deserves. The snakefolk man who unearthed the Dagger of Lost Souls is the culprit. This artifact controls the flow of life and death and can be used to create unimaginable numbers of undead abominations. This must be stopped.

Explore fantasy worlds and immersive adventures!

boardgame.name: Limitless Heroics: Including Characters with Disabilities, Mental Illness, and Neurodivergence
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This book is a tool to include disabled characters in a fifth edition setting, both Player Characters and Non-Player Characters. It helps the Game Master and players explore the concept of disability in a fantasy setting, raise awareness of disabled people and communities, and normalize interactions with disabled people.


Hundreds of disability symptoms
Tropes to avoid
Tips and handout for introducing in-game disabilities to your table


This book provides all you need to add disability symptoms to characters in 5th Edition and can be used by itself. It includes tables and instructions for adding symptoms and help to introduce the concept to players.

boardgame.name: The Curse of Bloodstone Isle - On the Peculiarities of Ruby Isle
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The tiny remote island of BloodStone might be the key to the multiverse, or at least the gateway to it. It is not located in just any one time or place, but it travels in and out of the Tempest to myriad worlds.

boardgame.name: The Curse of Bloodstone Isle - On the Peculiarities of Ruby Isle: Episode Two - Freeboot Landing
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Every journey begins somewhere, and most who venture to BloodStone Isle begin theirs by entering FreeBoot Landing. After materializing out of the Tempest, this region is unique, having only an isthmus connecting it to the mainland. Even so, this land bridge is almost always submerged about a foot or two underwater. On rare occasions it will appear as a dry sandy path.

boardgame.name: The Curse of Bloodstone Isle - On the Peculiarities of Ruby Isle: The Time & Space Trap, an Episodic Campaign of Myth, Mystery, and Madness - Episode Three: BoneDust Dunes
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A desolate sand waste on the coast of BloodStone Isle between a bay full of seagrass shallows on one side and the nightmarish Ragma Rift on the other, the BoneDust Dunes are more isolated and less forgiving than any other region of BloodStone Isle. Constant dry wind during the hot season and centuries of trampling by the tortoise-like Kralings have left a morass of chalky powder in a vast dune field that is difficult to traverse and nearly impossible to navigate. The BoneDust itself is fine, choking, caustic sand that pervades every square inch and crevice of the Dunes, making travel a blinding and staggering affair. When driven by wild Tempest winds, ghastly electrically-charged haboobs can blacken noon skies and drive every inhabitant under any available cover. Under more normal circumstances, the lack of fresh water, scorching wind and inevitable dust everywhere discourage visitors. These badlands have sifted out all but those singularly independent tenants of Dyar and its surroundings who cling to every scrap of freedom, because few would come so far out into the treacherous sands to attempt to take it from them.

boardgame.name: The Curse of BloodStone Isle Issue 1 - Vol 1
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

I felt distinctly that all eyes were on me as I walked into the Hull. It was a massive tavern, a beached ship said to be the oldest permanent structure in Broken Gallows, and now the most popular watering hole in the pirate city. As my eyes adjusted to the gloom, I felt a sense of disappointment. Once proud trophies of raids on other worlds hung prominently displayed from the beams of the beached vessel, but today the glories of past victories were covered in dust, threadbare and tarnished. Sullen conversations drifted from shadowed alcoves. Once famed for revelry, the Hull was now a haunt for nostalgia. Like the rest of the island, Broken Gallows was a shadow of its past.

boardgame.name: The Curse of BloodStone Isle Issue 1 - Vol 2
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

I first set foot on Freeboot Landing after crossing the narrow isthmus known as the Tidal Causeway. As I trekked through the knee-deep icy salt water, I could not help but notice dozens of raggedy villagers collecting crab shells of all kinds. I considered asking them the purpose of this endeavor, but was eager to be once again on dry land and their response, no doubt, would require enduring tedious accounts of their customs regarding these trinkets.

boardgame.name: The Curse of BloodStone Isle Issue 1 - Vol 3
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

As I was leaving FreeBoot Landing, I found myself staring in the distance at a great expanse of dunes that stretched out to the sea. I journeyed toward them, and upon reaching their location I realized that they were made of the finest sands I have ever encountered. I had been told that this region was called the BoneDust Dunes, and I came to understand why with that first grasp of its desolate sand. After trekking arduously through the sands for only an hour, I realized how difficult my journey was going to be if I did not secure a sound guide to lead me.

boardgame.name: The Curse of BloodStone Isle Issue 1 - Vol 4
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

As I began my trek from the Dunes to the BlightFens, I knew that I would need a guide. I began my search, heading to the place known as the Eotin Hills. As I neared the location, I came across the most peculiar of creatures—it had a small stature, three eyes, four arms, and five tentacle-like limbs that it used as legs to move about. He called himself F’whaug and claimed with grand and confusing gestures to be the best collector of trinkets in all the Fens. After just a short trek, however, it became abundantly clear F’whaug was a terrible guide and far too preoccupied in trying to pickpocket what valuables I had. After confronting him I left him just a quarter of a mile from the Eotin Hills. His dejected demeanor was almost comical as he made to return to his home, defeated and empty handed.

boardgame.name: The Curse of BloodStone Isle Issue 1 - Vol 5
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

I shielded my eyes against the sun and saw what looked like the remains of a sea battle, but on land. Wrecked ships in different states of repair, turned into buildings, in some cases with driftwood houses and shacks built around them, into them, and on them, all in a confusing disarray. Here and there burnt out ruins blackened the area. It looked different from the sea, more of a dead thing, than the lively town I had walked through earlier, but the name was fitting: Broken Gallows.

boardgame.name: The Curse of BloodStone Isle Issue 1 - Vol 6
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Is there beauty in death? In BleakStone City I was forced to reconsider my thoughts on the subject. The ancient ruins of this once glorious ivory city stretch for miles, made almost entirely of bleached marble. A solemn defiant beauty still clings to the ruins, somehow echoed in the stumps and torn down facades. Everywhere I see traces of life-changing art beyond my wildest imagination. I had entered another world. The wind stirred up the fine white dust; I covered my mouth and nose and pressed on. I wished for rain. I was unable to shake the sensation of being watched.

boardgame.name: Void Empires: 2750
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Void Empires: 2750 is a game about science fiction adventures. The game ultimately revolves around a group people creating characters and having adventures such as: post-apocalyptic survival scrounging, battling it out with psi-blades and psi powers, marauding bug-alien hives, and epic battles in vehicles, mechanized walkers and space craft. Void Empires: 2750 aims to provide a toolkit that supports any of these adventures, for use either with the native setting or a setting of your creation.

Despite the toolkit approach of Void Empires: 2750, there are some core concepts that define the overall tone of the mechanics, technology, and the native setting. Below you will find high level descriptions of these core concepts, all of which can be easily changed should the GM wish to do so for their universe.

boardgame.name: Martin Luther, Life and Legacy
boardgame.description:
Its October 31st, 1517 and a monk in Wittenberg, Germany nails 95 Theses to a church door asking for reform. Soon, you'll be embroiled in religious upheavals, territorial conflicts, and high politics within the Imperial Courts of the Holy Roman Empire.

This card game allows you to make decisions that influenced the political, religious, and economic causes of the Reformation - introducing you to the places, people, and events that shaped history.

You’ll direct the most powerful and influential leaders of the day such as Pope Leo X, Holy Roman Emperor Charles V, and Prince Elector Frederick III - using their talents with care during gameplay.

The game’s simple mechanics combined with multiple paths to victory gives it a fast pace providing excitement and opportunity to the very last play. We believe the unique experience Martin Luther, Life and Legacy provides -- will make it a treasured part of your game collection for years to come.

boardgame.name: Dragon of Icespire Peak Preview
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This book contains a special preview version of some of the material first presented in the D&D Essentials Kit and is meant as a new group's first DUNGEONS & DRAGONS experience. The short adventure material, characters, and other supplemental information here should get a group started on their journey.

boardgame.name: 18Write
boardgame.description:
Lay track, build train stations, and run trains. Keep all the train companies at a minimal stock market value to win. Be careful, if one company does too well, the others' stock values will drop.

At the end of 10 rounds, players must have managed 3 companies stock market values so that they are above a minimum value. The game implements an "equilibrium" mechanic, where one value going up might cause another value to go down.

-"Equilibrium": Keep values in equilibrium, rather than win by VPs or efficiency.

-"Suboptimal Assistants": Work cooperatively with an AI, however the AI does not always make the smartest decisions, so you will have to carefully choose when and where to take things over manually.

The game also comes with four maps to play and "Rails" a multi-map campaign. There is also an expansion that comes with more maps and game features.

This is a PNP submitted to the 2021 Solo PNP contest here on BGG.

boardgame.name: Last War: West 1968/1989 – Expansion Pack
boardgame.description: An Expansion for Last War: West about conflict on 1968/1989
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Last War: West

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: VYSHiBALY: Ramstein AFB
boardgame.description:
Op VISHiBALY: The Capture of Ramstein AFB

5th June, 04:00hrs, 24hrs before CASE RED, CASE BLUE and CASE BLACK, the Invasion of West Germany, 1984 and Ramstein is assaulted by a battalion force of VDV with the intention of disrupting the REFORGER effort to re-supply and re-inforce Germany as WWIII errupts.
At the same time VDV are assaulting Grafenrheinfeld Nuclear Power Station to tie up the 3rd Infantry Division,
Op. Vishibaly is designed to disrupt REFORGER as well as tie up elements of the 8th Infantry Division denying them supporting 3rd Armoured and CASE RED's thrust.

Elements of the VDV are to seize and deny ramstein, take it out of action and then form up to head in formation to Frankfurt Un Der Main AFB and eliminate that... if there any survivors of Vishibaly!

The scenario set is designed with full (generic) force lists for the VDV as well as the 8th Infantry Division;
four linked scenarios ranging from the initial assault on Ramstein, to ambushing the relief column of the 8th iD and a 1:1 type scenario where a Spetznatz team infiltrates the control tower and seizes it versus a force of USAF Security Personnel.

These scenarios are designed to be generic -so can be used with ANY rule set!
Ideally suited for COLD WAR3! and BERLIN '84 these scenarios can be used with Team Yankee or even Command decision or Bolt Action!

–Description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Bolt Action
Cold War 3! Rules for Modern Warfare 1960-1990: 4th Edition
Command Decision: Test of Battle
World War III: Team Yankee

boardgame.name: Micro Medusa
boardgame.description:
Micro Medusa is a 2 player competitive drafting, tile building and tile-revealing game. Players can be The Mighty Medusa, trying to extend their serpentine tress and defeat the intruding Champion. Or be the Champion, who is charged with using their equipment and cunning wit to anticipate Medusa’s next move without being turned into stone.

Players play a tile from their drafted hand onto the field. Medusa plays tiles in face down, hidden from the champion, and the champion places a responding tile face up adjacent to that tile. Medusa will then reveal the tile in order to resolve what happens. The outcome could tip the scale!

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Lost Mummy
boardgame.description:
The mysterious Egyptian sands hide many secrets, all of them lost to time. All of them, that is, except one!

When your grandfather, Howard Carter, discovered the remains of the ancient pharaoh Tutankhamen, he believed there was another tomb connected to the first. A hidden tomb. A Lost Mummy. Now, many hard years and one fateful slip later, you find yourself trapped in that very tomb! Will you escape, or will you become just another lost memory buried under the sand?

The Lost Mummy is a printable escape room game that transforms any space into a kids escape room experience. The game is designed to challenge 10 – 13 year-old children. It combines the teamwork, tension, and puzzle-solving of escape rooms with the laid-back ease of group party games.

Players will work together to escape from an ancient Egyptian tomb before time runs out. Gameplay is centered on a series of sequential puzzle sheets hidden around the room. Each puzzle solved progresses the story, and puts you one step closer to escaping the Lost Mummy’s tomb. Game setup is quick and spoiler-free, and hints are handled by an online hint system that players access on their smartphones. This means that no game master is required to supervise the experience, so you can join the game alongside your players.

The game can expand to accommodate any number of players by dividing your group into teams of 2-4, and then having them race against each other to see who escapes first. In addition, you can edit the game file before printing to customize your own escape room experience.

Will you solve the mystery of the mummy’s tomb, before you’re trapped here forever?

boardgame.name: Fruit Salad
boardgame.description:
In this very simple and fun game, the players take turns trying to get all the ingredients to make a nice fruit salad: grapes, blueberries, strawberries, kiwis, tangerines and bananas. The first one to complete the set wins.

In terms of gameplay, initially there's a pile with fruit and "veggie" tokens. Each player on their turn rolls two custom dice, one with the 6 fruits on its faces and one blank, except for one face, that shows a broccoli ("veggie"). Depending on the roll, they either pick up a corresponding fruit token or a veggie token from the pile. If they already have the fruit, they have the option of picking up a second one (only up to two per fruit are allowed) or return their fruit token back to the pile.

Veggie tokens are "jokers", in that they can stand in the place of any fruit token. However if you roll for veggie and already have one, you have to give it back; you can have at most one veggie at any given time.

Winning condition is having exactly 6 different tokens (6 fruit or 5 fruit and a veggie) with no duplicates.

boardgame.name: 16 Sheep
boardgame.description:
You can’t imagine how naughty Grandpa Emmet’s sheep are! They have escaped from the pen and are hiding among the bushes. Will you be able to find them with the help of Grandpa Emmet?

The objective of the game is to find the sheep indicated by the die each turn and take them to your pen. The more you find, the better! At the end of the game, the player with the most bushes with sheep is the winner.

_______________________________________________

¡Hay que ver lo traviesas que son las ovejas del abuelo Eugenio! Se han escapado del redil y se han escondido entre los arbustos. ¿Seréis capaces de encontrarlas con la ayuda del abuelo?

El objetivo de la partida es encontrar las ovejas que indique el dado en cada turno y llevarlas a tu redil. ¡Cuantas más encuentres, mejor! Al final de la partida, ganará quien haya reunido el mayor número de arbustos con ovejas.

boardgame.name: LadyUp
boardgame.description:
The colourful and cheerful dance of the bugs is about to start! Ladybugs, bees, beetles, and spiders gather in the meadow to have a wonderful time. They are going to perform an amazing dance, spinning around, doing somersaults... up and down in a fun and joyful choreography. Can you replicate their moves and create the same choreographies as the bugs?

In Lady Up, you compete against the rest of the players to be the first one to place your Bug tokens on the table forming the same pattern shown by the Choreography card in play.

______________________________________________

¡Empieza el colorido y animado baile de los bichos! Mariquitas, abejas, escarabajos y arañas se unen en el prado para pasarlo bomba. Van a interpretar una danza de película, dando vueltas y volteretas y girando sobre sí mismos en un alegre y divertido
baile.
¿Serás capaz de imitar sus movimientos y crear las mismas coreografías que formen los bichos?

En Lady Up compites contra el resto de participantes para ser el primero en colocar tus fichas de bicho sobre la mesa copiando la formación que indica la carta de coreografía en juego.

boardgame.name: Europa Universalis IV: Evangelical Majors Unit Pack
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Eight extra unique units for the Evangelical Major nations in Europe such as Sweden, Brandenburg/Prussia and France.

boardgame.name: Europa Universalis IV: Catholic Majors Unit Pack
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Nine extra units for the three Major Catholic powers Austria, Spain and Portugal.

boardgame.name: King of Tokyo/King of New York: Golem (promo character)
boardgame.description: Golem is a promo monster for King of Tokyo and King of New York. It's released to the public in the Czech Republic, and possibly Slovakia as well.

listing.notes:
Brand new, un-played, and unopened in zip lock baggy. (stand included)
Shipping : ~$15 for tracked shipping
NOTE: Pricing in CAD
Brand new, never used. mint condition. Please send me a PM for a shipping estimation before buying.

Golem promotional monster for King of Tokyo/New York. Brand new, unused, and in mint condition.
USA Shipping Options: Tracked First Class Package - $4.00
International Shipping Options: Tracked First Class Package - Varies depending on location, but typically around $16.00

boardgame.name: The Lion and the Hunter
boardgame.description:
The Lion and the Hunter is a game where one player is the lion and the other is the hunter. Players follow a route to the lions den. Along the way they must follow instructions as the come to them along the path.
The winner is the one who reaches the lions den first. Alternatively if the hunter lands on the space occupied by the lion after space 60 he has captured the lion and the hunter wins the game. Prior to space 60 if either player lands on the other player then the player landed on goes back to the start.

boardgame.name: Telepatio
boardgame.description:
Telepatio is a fun and engaging board game for believers of Telepathy and skeptics alike. With the help of colourful renditions of the original Zener cards as well as your very own minds, you and your friends can perform the same scientific experiment to disover which one of you has the greatest capacity for telepathic communication - or simply is the luckiest. Who knows? See for yourself!

Telepatio is turn-based and played over 24 rounds, or until the first player reaches 17 or -11 ESP points. You score ESP points by successfully sending or receiving the correct telepathic signals.

Every round a player assumes the role of a 'Sender'. The Sender rolls the Zener dice with the dice cup and views the result in secrecy. The Sender then flips over the hourglass, and must try to telepathically communicate the right Zener symbol to the other players. No words or visual cues of any kind are allowed, you must rely on the power of your mind.

By the time the hourglass runs out all other players, known as 'Recipients', must have chosen a Zener card with the symbol they believe is being telepathically sent to them. The Sender then reveals their dice roll and Recipients reveal their cards. Was the Sender successful in communicating the Zener symbol? Did the Recipients read Sender's mind, or did they score by simple guesswork?

If a Recipient chooses the wrong card, the Recipient moves one step back. The Sender moves as many steps forward as the number of correct matches from the Recipients, plus two extra steps. If the Sender does not match up with any of the Recipients, the Sender stays put.

The player with the most ESP points after 24 rounds is the most telepathic of the players, or does it all come down to luck?

boardgame.name: Smokey Game
boardgame.description:
The Smokey Game is an Australian community service board game for the prevention of forest fires. Players move by roll of a dice along a 60 space course that enters a Picnic ground and Koala sanctuary before continuing on to return to home on space 60.

Along the way certain green spaces promote good fire prevention practices and in turn help the player (i.e take a short cut). Red squares on the path highlight dangerous fire behaviour and this incurs a penalty to the player (i.e. Playing with matches go back to 26).

First player to complete the course is the winner.

boardgame.name: The Bell Must Toll Tonight
boardgame.description:
From the description:

The Bell Must Toll Tonight is a 2 to 3 hour one-shot for the world's most popular roleplaying game. Balanced around 4 players of 4th level characters, the adventure features dark themes and a party of investigators racing against the clock. Premade characters with custom sets of abilities are provided to allow new and veteran players to get started quickly on game night.

Overview
The players take roles as members of Venator Obscuras, a guild dedicated to the investigation and containment of dangerous supernatural and magical phenomena. The guild tasks the characters with an investigation into strange energy surges in the town of Neverpeak. The investigation pits them against a demon and tosses them in a race against time. The characters must reach a set of anointed bells outside of Neverpeak and ring them before midnight to close the gates that open on Spirit's Eve or the demon will be allowed to wander the realm of the living all year, along with whatever else comes through later.

Contents
Inside the adventure pdf you will find all you need to run the one-shot including:

5 Premade Characters
9 Encounters
1 New Monster Stat Block

boardgame.name: Darkness Beyond Hollowridge
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Darkness Beyond Hollowridge is an adventure module for the world's most popular roleplaying game. This adventure should span several sessions of play for 4 characters of 6th level. The civilized areas of a deep woodland fight against a corrupting force. Insert this adventure into another campaign world or use it to run a short campaign.

Overview
The Marsdon Woodland is host to a new cult that works to bring their deity of darkness to power. The cult’s work causes havoc across the forest and within the city of Hollowridge. The characters contend with the cult and its hirelings and goons. Characters will travel from ragtag bandit camps to dangerous caverns that transform around them. Within the heart of the cult’s base, they will fight in the darkness of the deity’s realm to stop the ritual.

boardgame.name: ThunderZine (Issue #6)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the ThunderZine, the support 'zine for all of Kyoudai Games brands, including the Infinity's Edge Role-Playing Game, the Tiny Legacies line of sourcebooks for Tiny Supers, and Thunderscape in all its many forms!

The ThunderZine is developed for and with the members of the Kyoudai Games Patreon, who get it several months in advance of the public and who have the opportunity to contribute ideas and requests for specific content.

In this sixth issue:

Two new Specialist Classes for Infinity's Edge: the Bounty Hunter and the Pirate!
A continued exploration of the Three Kingdoms, a new setting for Infinity's Edge!
An introduction to the Sixteen, folk heroes of Urbana, for Thunderscape TinyD6!
The city of Strangemont, a technological and magic-phobic stronghold, for Thunderscape TinyD6!
Breakout!, an introductory scenario for Tiny Legacies!
In Random Heroes, we meet Torment, a mystical nightmare for Tiny Legacies!

boardgame.name: Tech Grid Poker
boardgame.description:
Tech Grid Poker adds a new dimension to traditional poker! Classical Texas Hold'em poker uses a single row of communal cards. Grid poker uses a 3x3 array of cards from which players make two poker hands simultaneously. Players form one poker hand using the communal cards in the rows of the grid and another poker hand using the communal cards in the columns. Additionally, each card has unique game effects which players can use to influence the outcome.

At the start of the game, a 3x3 grid of communal cards is dealt. This is called "the market". Each player is dealt 7 cards and selects 2 of them to form a company. Each turn players can use the game effect on one card in their company and one from the cards in their hands. Then, in the grid poker phase, players use their company and hand cards to simultaneously form two poker hands. One of the poker hands must use their company cards and another must use cards from their hand. One of the poker hands must use the row cards and the other the column cards in the market. The best poker hand among the rows is determined and scores the row winner point(s). Then, the best poker hand among the column hands is determined and scores the column winner point(s). Companies can be improved each round using hand cards. The game ends after four rounds.

Grid Poker uses the Tech Deck which is a game system. Each Tech Deck card has game effects, a value and domain (suit). The Tech Deck is designed to serve as the basis for many other games.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Curse of the Eternal Undead
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In Curse of the Eternal Undead, a group of level-7 characters encounters rumors and truths about a strange development in the jungle. Scores of mindless undead come from a decrepit pyramid in the jungle's depths. The undead ravage the land, kill townsfolk, and have forced the locals to flee from their homeland in search of safety. A local guide and former adventurer has explored the territory and looks for a group of saviors to join and fight.

The adventurers learn that some of the undead are not aggressive nor obedient to the one who created them. They are cursed with a semblance of life; caught in a loop for eternity. A fate that no one deserves. The snakefolk man who unearthed the Dagger of Lost Souls is the culprit. This artifact controls the flow of life and death and can be used to create unimaginable numbers of undead abominations. This must be stopped.

boardgame.name: Awkward
boardgame.description:
Awkward is the ultimate test on finding out how well friends, couples, and family know each other!

In Awkward, on a players turn, they pick up a question card and choose between two options labelled A or B. They then place one of the voting cards (either A or B) facedown while everyone guesses which answer they chose and also place a voting card facedown. The answer is revealed and the players who guessed correctly are awarded with a Wick Point and the first to get 10, wins!

boardgame.name: Grim Noir: A GUMSHOE Film Noir RPG
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An occult mystery roleplaying game powered by the GUMSHOE system

Grim Noir is a film noir RPG about occult mysteries and shady deals in dark alleys and glamorous restaurants. In Grim Noir you take on the role of a group of detectives that gather clues in order to piece together a solution to the mystery your game master has created. In Grim Noir mysteries have a supernatural or an occult twist that makes them too dangerous for the City’s regular police. But not for you. You are are a Reaper.

Take on the role of Reapers, people who have a special ability to see and take hold of souls. You can use this ability to gather clues from the dead or to sell the souls you gather for money, favors or supernatural abilities. This will be both your strength and weakness. The power you gain through dealing souls will let you solve the dangerous cases you come across but seeing the supernatural can strain your sanity. Can you balance between your normal life and the life of Reaper?

A GUMSHOE system with a film noir twist
The renowned GUMSHOE system is designed for playing investigative roleplaying games, allowing the players to focus on the story, rather than worry about whether their characters can find the clues to advance the plot. Grim Noir uses this established rules system and builds on top of it some new mechanics that are specifically made for this game. The GUMSHOE system is rules light and offers a cinematic style of play where the story comes first. The rules help keep the story moving forward and facilitate a fun investigative game.

The Investigative Abilities such as Interrogation, Evidence Collection, and Occult Studies allow your Investigators to find clues that push the story forward. The General Abilities such as Athletics, Persuasion, and Infiltration get your Investigators in and out of trouble. The game also uses a Stability mechanic, which is used to measure your Investigator's mental fortitude against experiencing the occult horrors of Grim Noir.

Capture and barter souls
As Reapers you are able to capture souls of the dead, and question them to gather evidence and clues normal detectives could never get their hands on. Alternatively, you can sell the souls to Agents of Heaven and Hell in order to gain supernatural powers that will help you survive the spiral of doom you will inevitably decent into. The game features over 10 supernatural powers for the players to gain, each one giving a new way of approaching investigation or dealing with any threats the players may face - whether they are mundane or supernatural.

Narrate your own solutions
Grim Noir features a unique new mechanic for earning Narrative Points from roleplaying your character in a film noir manner: by giving a Monologue to share the point of view of your character. You can then use your Narrative Points to alter the the game to your advantage by narrating Flashbacks and changing some details in the game scenes. This way you always have some control over your characters actions, without having to spend too much time planning every detail of the investigation.

Will you solve the mysteries of the City, or will you become one of the lost souls roaming it?

boardgame.name: Dead-End Murder
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A high profile business man is found murdered under strange circumstances. The higher-ups want to bury the case as a “straightforward, run-of-the-mill murder”, but there are too many puzzle pieces that do not match.

There isn't a snowball's chance in hell that you'll let this one go without getting to the bottom of it.

Dead-End Murder is an example case for Grim Noir RPG, designed to introduce new players to the game and its world. This booklet contains a self-contained adventure, example characters and clues that the players will collect during the game. It has been designed to work as a standalone story, or as a great start for a longer campaign.

The case file features:

Premade characters for three players
Dozens of clues, ready to be printed and handed to the players
Map with clearly marked story locations
A gripping film noir mystery for the players to solve

boardgame.name: Vicious Spiral
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

When a good friend ends up dead in his own home, it is up to his friends to find out what happened and seek revenge.

Vicious Spiral is a free example adventure for Grim Noir RPG. This case file also appears in the [Grim Noir Core Book].

This document is intended for the Game Masters to have an easier access to the case file and does not include any extra content.

boardgame.name: BinderPlot v.02: The Mupplome Take a Manor
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Just this side of Halloween The Mupplome Take a Manor is an adventure seed/ spooky sandbox of a house designed for 3-4 characters of Level 2-4 playing the Pathfinder roleplaying game (Second Edition).

Your players will meet several potential new allies (and/or foils) as they explore an eclectic two-story manor house growing over with vines on the edge of town.

This 22 page adventure (plus bonus cover and exciting legal page!) includes:

Over two dozen detailed room descriptions!
Full Color floormaps! (for both GM reference and VTT upload)
Colorful Illustrations!
Weird monsters!
Weirdo friends!
Maybe a deal with a dragon?
Maybe a deal with a cat?
Maybe a new headquarters if your party plays things right!
A Bonus playable Heritage for the Mupplome Ancestry describing tiny colorful weirdos that live in the crevices of your house.
YES! Your house!
It’s magical. A magic house.

boardgame.name: BinderPlot v.01: Pull into the Wood
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Pull into the Wood is a 5 page system neutral contemporary tale about a man who went into the forest and dissapeared in a violent way.
It is set within a National Park in the state of Washington, but the drama is universal and can be slightly remolded and dropped into any campaign with an excess of humans, minimally managed patches of nature, and a Parliament of Trees.

This adventure comes complete with two exclusive Binder Maps representing key locations in the Plot; a Campsite, and the Body Grove.

boardgame.name: The Gaia Complex: A Game of Flesh and Wires
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Gaia Complex is a cyberpunk roleplaying game set in New Europe: a single sprawling metropolis that covers much of what we currently know as mainland Europe. In the year 2119, New Europe is a world of street violence, espionage, vampiric uprisings and an overzealous A.I., known as Gaia, which functions as the city’s governor and the protector of its citizens.

The Gaia Complex is a game of conspiracy and brutality, where players take on the roles of Mercs; former police officers, hackers and street-savvy dealers who are hired to fight back against the system and ultimately unravel the secrets of The Gaia Complex.

This core book provides everything that players need to hit the streets of New Europe, including a detailed insight into the world and background, the complete 12.3 rules system, character creation, a huge catalogue of technology & equipment and guidance on running exciting game sessions

boardgame.name: Nebula of Mirrors
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

OLD SECRETS, NEW LIES.

This pulse-pounding espionage campaign draws the PCs deep into the darkest secrets of the Human Sphere. Betrayed by their friends, and with their enemies turning into strange allies, can they untangle their twisted triangle of allegiances before the Code Infinity unleashes its destructive force?

A terrifying sequence of events is set in motion when a simple “babysitting” operation fails catastrophically on a Dawn caravanserai. Burned by O-12, can the PCs track down the traitors responsible and learn the truth about the O-12’s shadowy Charon Committee?

From the bitter majesty of Dawn to the oppressive battlegrounds of Paradiso, they will soon learn that not all threats to the Human Sphere come from the Combined Army, and the enemy without pales to the enemy within!

In this book, you’ll find:

• A deep dive into the shadowy past of the O-12 where the ends always justified the means.
• New conflicts with Ikari Company and Druze society mercenaries.
• A fully detailed caravanserai and story hooks.
• Maps and actions scenes including a docking bay and a bar shootout.
• New adversaries such as Amaunet, Ziad Arslan, the Bellerophon Corporation, and Spiral Corps.
• A return to one of the pivotal locations in the Infinity universe’s history.
• Information on the Charon Committee, a sinister O-12 think-tank, whose members are not to be trusted.
• A Combined Army attack on Runenberg where the PCs must hold the line!
• A powerboat chase through flooded ruins

boardgame.name: Far Hissain
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Adventure awaits!

You’ve heard the tales of Far Hissain, home of the Summer Empire. Final resting place of the Sorcerer Kings and their fortunes. A mysterious land of tropical jungles and golden deserts filled with magical creatures known as the jinn. Far Hissain is a setting supplement for Warlock! The old school roleplaying game inspired by the early days of British tabletop gaming.

This book explores the land, its history, and its inhabitants. Included within these pages are twenty new spells, twelve basic careers, seven advanced careers, and thirty three new and exciting creatures native to the land.

boardgame.name: Pfandstrand
boardgame.description:
The beach could be so beautiful if there wasn't trash lying around everywhere.

Pfandstrand is a fast and funny bluffing game for 3 to 5 people. The special thing about it: the game consists of only one postcard and can be sent. All other materials needed can be found in a well sorted household. :)

The game is played simultaneously. All players show a number between 1 and 4 with one hand. The numbers correspond to the lanes of the playing field. Only the player who shows a number alone may move his playing piece to the next column; double numbers remain standing.

On their way, the players try to collect as much trash (game chips) as possible. The first player to reach the finish line receives two more chips. The winner is the player who was able to collect the most trash in total.

boardgame.name: Volle Scholle: Postkartenspiel
boardgame.description:
Climate change has major consequences for all of us. The polar ice caps are also melting.

In Volle Scholle, you have to pull your penguins across the melting ice to the finish line as quickly as possible. But watch out! If you risk too much, you'll swim.

Each player receives two game pieces (penguins). A player may roll the dice as many times as he wants. The numbers 3 to 6 each bring one movement point - if a player stops, he may distribute the movement points earned among his two penguins. On a 1 or 2, all points are lost and it is the next player's turn. After each round the ice melts, penguins standing on melted ice fall into the water and are out of the game. The winner is the player who gets the most penguins to the finish line, in case of a tie the fastest penguin.

The special thing about it: the game consists of only one postcard and can be sent. All other materials needed can be found in a well sorted household. :)

boardgame.name: Mole-in-One
boardgame.description:
Mole: "Ouch! I can dig and build wherever I want, because you won't catch me after all!" Fox: "We'll see which one of us is the smarter one!"

Mole-in-one is an exciting bluffing game for 2 people: One person plays the fox, the other the mole. The mole can only score points by cleverly digging the tunnels. But if the smart fox catches him, the game is over.

Mole and fox start on their starting square. The mole starts and says how many ditch walks he is moving - 1, 2 (3 times in the game) or 3 (1 times in the game) walks. He notes hidden the hill he is now in. The fox may move 1 or 2 hills. If the fox is on the mole's hill at the end of the turn, the mole must admit it and the game ends.

Before his turn, the mole may show himself: he names the hill he is in and notes the points. If the mole has been caught, he adds up the points earned. Now swap roles and see who can score more points.

The special feature is that the game consists of only one postcard and can be sent. All other materials needed can be found in a well-stocked household :)

boardgame.name: 5 Room Dungeons Zine #4: The Furnace of Natasibit-Chu
The Furnace of Natasibit-Chu
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

5 Room Dungeon Zine #4 is a dungeon romp where the party must save folk enslaved by evil hobgoblins to run a furnace powered by a great dam.

The furnace itself powers a forge. Guided by a mysterious master, evil Kruance and his crew of thugs craft and sell lodesteel wares to all manner of ill-meaning customers.

Can the party stop this nefarious scheme and save the prisoners?

Only you will know when you run....The Furnace of Natasibit-Chu.

This adventure features:

A complete 5 Room Dungeon ready to GM with minimal prep
New creatures including Lode Golems, Tunnel Worgs, Devil Pact Hobgoblins
New magic item: a Lodesteel Weapon
There is also a layered map PDF so you can easily print or export maps for VTT or offline play.

boardgame.name: Ozam!
boardgame.description:
The divine protector, Ozam, guards the Sun and the Moon. Yet, these two heavenly orbs are under attack from all sides by the horrifying “Chaoscreeps”. Wizen and frail, Ozam is searching for a warrior of talents to win 3 out of 5 battles to inherit his role and power, destroy the Chaoscreep and save the Earth.

Ozam uses 5 different Card Play Conflict resolution mechanisms with differing win conditions. Players who win 3 of 5 battles, win the game.

boardgame.name: Fashion Business
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Monica is the boss; rich and high in society, but things might change for her in the future!

This game has some explicit sex scenes.

boardgame.name: The Hunger of Firspeak
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Hunger of Firspeak is a level 3 Adventure designed to take both new and experienced players on a short, exciting journey into the Frozen North!

New players and DMs will get a taste of combat and roleplay, as well as how to take players through basic encounters with suggested dialogue options for NPCs and resolutions for different options players may take.

Experienced players and DMs will enjoy a nice easy-to-play 2-3hr adventure to slot into or in between existing campaigns.

boardgame.name: Action Taimanin
boardgame.description:
Story
In the near future, Japan is plagued with the demons from the dark side.
There existed an ancient, unspoken rule of non-interference between humans and demons, but as the humanity descends into decadande, the rule is now obsolete; it is the darkest time, with the criminal syndicates pulling the strings.

But those who sought the righteous path were not hopeless.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Postman
boardgame.description:
the Postman has a lot of work handing out all the letters.

The quickest player in finding the neighbors to whom belong the letters, will be de winner! The first player to match to letters, wins!
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Theme: Mail / Stamps / The Post Office

boardgame.name: Angel Wings
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Korean visual novel dating simulator where you get a mysterious call and awake in an unknown place filled with beautiful women.

The game have more than seven storylines with over 20 endings and hundreds of branching choices.

boardgame.name: Jammerlappen
boardgame.description:
For once, this dramatically funny card game is not about winning! Use your action cards cleverly against your fellow players and get rid of your cards as quickly as possible so as not to be the whiner.

First the hand cards, then the open and finally the face down cards are played. As long as you still hold hand cards, it is forbidden to play the open or face down cards. Only when you no longer hold hand cards, you are allowed to play the open and released face cards.

Face-down cards must always be played blindly and must not be viewed beforehand.

As long as there is still a recording stack, each player must always hold at least 3 hand cards. You may not play the open cards until all hand cards have been discarded.

boardgame.name: The One Ring Starter Set
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Boxed starter set including rules, adventures, pre-generated characters, maps, and cards for use during play.

boardgame.name: The One Ring Loremaster's Screen & Rivendell Compendium
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Three-panel Loremaster's Screen in landscape format, plus 12-page Rivendell Compendium booklet.

boardgame.name: Kenji's Quest: Book One
boardgame.description:
Kenji’s Quest takes the best elements from the 90’s era adventure/rpg console games and translates them to the tabletop. Featuring exploration, turn-based battles, mini-games, and more—Kenji’s Quest utilizes a ground-breaking Companion App to enhance the experience.

Using the Companion App, the Game Host leads the players through the game by displaying art, showing stats during battle, playing sound—like our Battle Theme below—and much more.

Designed as a trilogy, Kenji’s Quest: Book One allows for you and your friends to experience the book’s six chapters—but here’s a crucial twist—the decisions you make influence the plot, the content you experience, and eventual outcome of the story.

boardgame.name: 5 Room Dungeons Zine #5: A Hero's Path
A Hero's Path
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a 1-on-1 adventure to help new players who have not played RPGs before learn the magic of our beloved hobby.

Each encounter is specially designed to show your player something new about the game and prompt them to engage and take action.

Written by Roleplaying Tips Patron and player in my Barbossa campaign Leonard Blakey, this 67 page 5 Room Dungeon (the largest 5 Room Dungeon yet!) takes a 0 level character and their NPC friend from the safety of their village onto a magical Living Path that ends in the PC attaining level 1 and a class.

Can your player help save their village from The Shepherd and his band of nasty outlaws who rampage inside a wondrous creature known as the Living Path?

This adventure features:

A complete 5 Room Dungeon ready to GM with minimal prep
New creatures including the Living Path, Bridge Guardians, and The Shepherd
New magic item: Banquet Spork, Stick of Class Detection, Living Pebble, and Medusa Tears
New NPCs
Handouts

boardgame.name: 5 Room Dungeons Zine #6: The Big Mouth
The Big Mouth
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Imagine being swallowed by a massive, treasure-seeking whale.

And that whale is infested with exploding pockets of stomach acid, killer tapeworms, and backstabbing NPCs.

I predict great gaming lies ahead, if you can stomach it. Ba dum bum.

And guess how the party must escape? It'll be a real pain in the you-know-what for our poor monster. Ewww.

This adventure features:

A complete 5 Room Dungeon ready to GM with minimal prep
New creatures including Dolphins, Whalewurms, Great Wurms, and the Filth Mound
New magic item: the Soulgem

boardgame.name: Cleric Domain: Marked Guardian Domain
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Clerics of the Marked Guardian Domain have been anointed and sworn to protect a history lost to the world. Forced to forsake the outside world either by birthright or by joining those who would guard these ancient secrets, you have had this history marked upon your body, either through ceremonial tattoos or bloodletting, and shared it only through oral tradition.

Building off of the existing Fifth Edition rules to build a cleric character, the Marked Guardian Domain gives you options to build an enigmatic cleric, a member of a secret society who bears the records of a lost history in tattoos and markings.

boardgame.name: Steamy Deck & Winners Tokens
boardgame.description:
Expansion created by Datebox Club which includes 20 additional word cards and 9 winner tokens.

—user summary
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Cross Clues

boardgame.name: Story Seeds Collection 11
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sometimes you need a quick story for your players. Not a complete campaign, or even an adventure, but something you can modify to fit your table. You need a Story Seed.

DRP Story Seed Collections feature two different ideas complete enough to build a session around, yet open enough that you can add/change details, and make it your own. Use them as-is, flesh them out, or use just the description as the base of your own adventure.

This system-agnostic collection includes:

Queen Winnifrith's dragon sactuary has been invaded by an evil spirit
A poisoned barbarian needs a dead king's magic sword to heal himself
boardgame.rpgseries: Dark Raptor Press Story Seeds Collections

boardgame.name: Story Seeds Collection 12
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sometimes you need a quick story for your players. Not a complete campaign, or even an adventure, but something you can modify to fit your table. You need a Story Seed.

DRP Story Seed Collections feature two different ideas complete enough to build a session around, yet open enough that you can add/change details, and make it your own. Use them as-is, flesh them out, or use just the description as the base of your own adventure.

This system-agnostic collection includes:

Return a 40 year old black cat to a woman (witch?) on the other side of Rusblut
Find a noble doctor who works at a madhouse treating the worst of the worst
boardgame.rpgseries: Dark Raptor Press Story Seeds Collections
